01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Lara Trump says the president 'was having fun' at a rally where supporters chanted 'lock her up' towards Michigan governor","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/lara-trump-gretchen-whitmer-fbi-militia-kidnap-plot-donald-trump-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4d8dc21cfb0019468a6d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lara-Trump\" height=\"1935\" width=\"2580\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Derek Davis/Portland Press Herald via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Lara Trump said on Sunday that President Trump's encouragement of \"lock her up\" chants used against Gov. Gretchen Whitmer at a Saturday campaign rally was just him \"having fun.\"</li>\n<li>It has been less than two weeks <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">since a plot to kidnap the governor was thwarted by the FBI.</a></li>\n<li>Lara Trump said that it was \"the president's Department of Justice that actually thwarted this attack against Gretchen Whitmer,\" so it was \"ridiculous\" to suggest he was trying to incite threats.</li>\n<li>Jason Miller, a senior advisor on the Trump campaign, said on Fox News Sunday that the president did not regret his attacks against Whitmer and that Michigan residents \"want to see the state open back up.\"</li>\n<li>Whitmer has said publicly that the president's rhetoric is harmful and causes even greater safety risks.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Two top campaign staffers for President Trump defended his encouragement of \"lock her up\" chants against Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer at a Saturday night rally held in her state.</p><p>On CNN's \"State of the Union,\" Lara Trump, the wife of presidential son Eric Trump and a senior advisor on the Trump campaign, argued that the \"lock her up\" chants used against Whitmer were not meant to cause any harm to the Democratic governor who, less than two weeks ago, was targeted <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">in a kidnapping plot thwarted by the FBI</a>.</p><p>\"He wasn't doing anything, I don't think, to provoke people to threaten this woman at all,\" she said. \"He was having fun at a Trump rally. And quite frankly, there are bigger issues than this right now for everyday Americans. People want to get the country reopened ... So I think people are frustrated. Look, the president was at a rally. It's a fun, light atmosphere. Of course he wasn't encouraging people to threaten this woman.\"</p><p>\"I don't think 'lock her up' is fun,\"&#160;CNN host Jake Tapper said.</p><p>Lara Trump said that it was \"ridiculous\" to suggest that Trump was inciting violence against the governor and stated that it was \"the president's Department of Justice that actually thwarted this attack against Gretchen Whitmer.\"</p><p>\"No one should ever feel threatened, no one should ever have this thing happen to them,\" she added. \"This was awful to happen to her.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;State of the Union  (@CNNSotu) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317820397627281408?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 18, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Jason Miller, a senior advisor on the Trump campaign, made an appearance on \"Fox News Sunday,\" where he stated that the president had no regrets about his rhetoric against Whitmer.</p><p>\"I think the fact of the matter is many residents of Michigan are pretty frustrated with the governor,\" he said, and \"they want to see the state open back up.\"</p><p>On Saturday, President Trump told a crowd at a rally in Muskegon, Michigan that Whitmer needed to remove the state's coronavirus restrictions, which led to them repeating the now-infamous \"lock her up\" chants which were <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-special-prosecutor-hillary-clinton-2016-10\">also directed toward Hillary Clinton in 2016</a>.</p><p>While also attacking Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, Trump responded to the crowd by saying \"lock 'em all up,\" which led Whitmer to take to Twitter on Saturday to explain why such language is harmful and created an unsafe situation for her family.</p><p>\"This is exactly the rhetoric that has put me, my family, and other government officials' lives in danger while we try to save the lives of our fellow Americans,\" Whitmer tweeted. \"It needs to stop.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Governor Gretchen Whitmer  (@GovWhitmer) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317589850527322112?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 17, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>On Sunday, Whitmer appeared on NBC's \"Meet the Press,\" where she stressed that the president's actions are unacceptable.</p><p>\"It's incredibly disturbing that the president of the United States — 10 days after a plot to kidnap, put me on trial and execute me — 10 days after that was uncovered, the president is at it again and inspiring and incentivizing and inciting this kind of domestic terrorism,\" she said. \"It's dangerous, not just for me and my family, but for public servants everywhere who are doing their jobs and trying to protect their fellow Americans.\"</p><p>Tori Saylor, Whitmer's deputy digital director, also took to Twitter to state that the attacks create a dangerous atmosphere. Her message has since gone viral.</p><p>\"I see everything that is said about and to her online,\" Saylor tweeted. \"Every single time the President does this at a rally, the violent rhetoric towards her immediately escalates on social media. It has to stop. It just has to.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Tori Saylor  (@tori_saylor) <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ip66wPXh2VQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 16:15:05 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4da89e9fe40019009f72?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"995c1c50b2faac1b10dbf7ac418dcadd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn55@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-37-112_59441dca4c4e1f1b.webp","destWidth":2638,"destHeight":1978,"sourceBytes":221092,"destBytes":221092,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4d8dc21cfb0019468a6d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn35@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-27-125_abfd2bd851642c0d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ip66wPXh2VQ:JlvochyDDpg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn36@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-29-089_ca3539f7ef1f05c9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ip66wPXh2VQ:JlvochyDDpg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn96@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-26-828_46031e680da27a7a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ip66wPXh2VQ:JlvochyDDpg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-28-359_a133b5845507c646.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ip66wPXh2VQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn60@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-35-421_92f08c2e8cc17282.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520883},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"In conservative South Carolina, Lindsey Graham should have cruised to an easy reelection this year. Jaime Harrison had other plans.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/jaime-harrison-lindsey-graham-south-carolina-senate-election-polls-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f810ffabab422001979a945?format=jpeg\" alt=\"harrison-1\" height=\"2160\" width=\"3240\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jaime Harrison, the Democratic Senate nominee in South Carolina, is locked in a tight race with Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Cheriss May/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Former state Democratic Party chairman Jaime Harrison is challenging three-term GOP Sen. Lindsey Graham for the US Senate in South Carolina.</li>\n<li>Once thought to be a safe hold for the Republicans, the Senate race has become part of the expanded Democratic calculus for winning a Senate majority.</li>\n<li>Several major polls, including surveys conducted by Morning Consult and Quinnipiac University, have shown the race either tied or with one candidate holding a small lead.</li>\n<li>Harrison has run a highly disciplined campaign, and a victory in South Carolina, a longtime bastion of Southern conservatism, would be a jolt to Democrats across the country.</li>\n<li>Democrats have not won a Senate race in the Palmetto State since 1998.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Lindsey Graham wasn't supposed to be in trouble anymore.</p><p>For years, the longtime US Senator from South Carolina had been viewed suspiciously by many Republicans in the Palmetto State, despite his mostly conservative voting record. From his willingness to vote for liberal-leaning Supreme Court nominees like Sonia Sotomayor and Elena Kagan to his outspoken criticism of Donald Trump during the 2016 Republican presidential campaign, Graham had universal name recognition, but lacked the strong support of GOP activists compared to fellow South Carolinians like Sen. Tim Scott and former Sen. Jim DeMint.</p><p>Then, Brett Kavanaugh happened.</p><p>In September 2018, the federal judge went through <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/christine-blasey-ford-perspective-senate-hearing-2018-9\">a bruising Supreme Court confirmation battle</a> after being accused of a decades-old sexual assault by Dr. Christine Blasey Ford, a California psychology professor. Graham, incensed by attacks on Kavanaugh during the hearings, lambasted Senate Democrats <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5_C7o5INBzw\">in a video</a> that went viral. Overnight, Graham had finally become \"one of the guys\" to many conservatives, with President Trump praising him and reelection to a fourth term looking like a sure bet.</p><p>In May 2019, Jaime Harrison entered the Senate race.</p><p>Harrison had a compelling life story as a native son who was raised by his grandparents in Orangeburg and went on to graduate from Yale University and the Georgetown University Law Center. He later worked as an aide to House Majority Whip Jim Clyburn and as a lobbyist in Washington before becoming the first Black chairman of the South Carolina Democratic Party. As a political moderate, he supported Medicaid expansion and raising the minimum wage, while opposing the Green New Deal and an elimination of the Senate filibuster.</p><p>Still, most pundits didn't give Harrison a chance. When he formally announced his run against Graham, he leaned heavily on themes of integrity and loyalty, values that he felt would resonate with voters.</p><p>\"Lindsey Graham can't lead us in any direction because he traded his moral compass for petty political gain,\" Harrison said <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qGL5dclzjHo\">in his first campaign ad</a>. \"He's forgotten about the people that he represents...You.\"</p><p>Over the past few months, Harrison's campaign has taken off, pushing Graham into the biggest political fight of his life.</p><h2>\"All Politics are Local\"</h2><p>Late last year, Harrison released an ad where he narrated the story of an older Black man who lived off a dirt road in a rural county. The man told Harrison that until a politician could pave his road, he didn't want to be bothered with an appeal for his vote.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Jaime Harrison  (@harrisonjaime) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1191464056500166656?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 4, 2019</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Harrison has campaigned on local concerns, seeking to revitalize communities across the state, preserve rural hospitals and expand access to educational opportunities. Lately, he has also been discussing ways to better handle the coronavirus pandemic that has left nearly 750,000 South Carolinians out of work.</p><p>He has drawn a sharp contrast with Graham, while increasing his own visibility in the process.</p><p>\"Our infrastructure is falling apart and we don't have broadband in our rural communities,\" Harrison told Business Insider in an interview. \"This is the song that we've been singing since we announced. Senator Graham just hasn't focused on these issues...He likes to play Washington political games. 'All politics are local' is true. You want someone with an ear to the ground and who understands the hardships that people are going through.\"</p><p>\"Senator Graham doesn't have that,\" he added.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f811aefbab422001979a94f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"graham-2\" height=\"2800\" width=\"3733\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sen. Lindsey Graham gives a speech on Capitol Hill.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Harrison also said that there's a trust factor that's gone, further severing a relationship with voters that once allowed Graham to win comfortably with the state's moderate Republicans and independents. Where Graham <a href=\"https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4772923/user-clip-sen-graham-ran-term-limits\">once supported Congressional term limits</a> and previously stated that <a href=\"https://twitter.com/vanitaguptacr/status/1307153104941518848\">presidents should not appoint</a> Supreme Court justices in presidential election years, he has now served in the Senate for 18 years, in addition to his 8 years in the House of Representatives, and he's on the cusp of successfully pushing through the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett less than a month before the November election.</p><p>\"He has not been honest with the people of this state,\" Harrison said. \"People appreciate you saying you've changed your mind if you just admit it...I believe that a man is only as good as his word.\"</p><h2>The Kavanaugh Effect</h2><p>In July 2015, when Graham and Trump were primary rivals for the GOP presidential nomination, Graham <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/25/magazine/lindsey-graham-what-happened-trump.html\">called Trump</a> a \"jacka--\" in an interview. Trump responded by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-lindsey-graham-phone-number-2015-7\">reading out Graham's cell phone number</a> on live television.&#160;</p><p>Five years later, Graham is now a reliable supporter of Trump's agenda and has become a confidant and occasional golf partner to the president, with their relationship strengthened by the Kavanaugh hearings as well as Graham's role as chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee.</p><p>Danielle Vinson, a professor of Politics and International Affairs at Furman University, said that the Kavanaugh hearings contributed to the erosion of Graham's standing throughout the state.</p><p>\"His defense of Kavanaugh certainly played well among conservatives, but it did not play well with liberals and women,\" she said. \"It felt like he was dismissing the allegations. A number of groups realized that he's [Harrison's] a quality challenger who knows the state and could register their frustrations.\"</p><p>This week, Graham will attempt to shepherd Barrett's Supreme Court nomination through the Senate in the face of a coronavirus pandemic that has killed over 3,500 South Carolinians since March.</p><p>Harrison is opposed to the Barrett nomination, criticizing the \"rushed\" timeline that Graham himself crafted.</p><h2>A Changing State</h2><p>The last Democratic presidential nominee to win South Carolina was Jimmy Carter, a former governor from neighboring Georgia, in 1976. In 1998, Ernest \"Fritz\" Hollings won reelection to his sixth and final Senate term, the last time a Democrat was elected to a statewide federal office in South Carolina; that same year, Democrat Jim Hodges was elected governor and since leaving office in 2003, no one from his party has won the Governor's Mansion. Democrats last won a statewide office in 2006 and have been the minority party in both houses of the South Carolina General Assembly for years.</p><p>Republicans have been dominant in the state since the mid-1990s and Graham has never received less than 54% of the vote in any of his three general elections. In November, Trump is strongly favored to carry the state once again.</p><p>Harrison, who has never held elective office, is tasked with figuring out how a South Carolina Democrat can actually win statewide in 2020.</p><p>\"I don't see a lot of [conservative] Greenville County Republicans voting Democratic,\" Vinson, the professor, said. \"But I could see the Charleston crowd supporting Harrison. [US Representative] Joe Cunningham has already won that area as a Democrat.\"</p><p>Cunningham, a moderate, was elected to the GOP-friendly 1st congressional district in 2018, a major upset in a district that had not sent a Democrat to Congress for 38 years.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f843373bab422001979aba1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Charleston-1\" height=\"2532\" width=\"3377\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jaime Harrison will have to perform strongly in the Charleston area to win a statewide race as a Democrat.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jeffrey Greenberg/Universal Images Group via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"Harrison's got to get the Democratic turnout in Greenville, and he'll have to rack up a lot of votes in Orangeburg, Columbia, the Midlands, and along the [Atlantic] coast to have a chance,\" Vinson said. \"There is still a moral conservative component to the state that won't evaporate anytime soon, but new international industries are locating here. If the state keeps that going and brings in more folks who aren't from this part of the country, it'll make things more competitive.\"</p><p>If Graham were to win, he would need to regain some of his past appeal with suburban voters and pick off independents who may be on the fence about Trump.</p><p>\"I haven't heard a lot of changes of heart in older voters,\" Vinson added. \"I think there are some conservative women who are pressured in general — from Trump's behavior to issues that affect their family like coronavirus. I really don't know how they will decide.\"</p><h2>A Tightening Race</h2><p>Earlier in the year, the few public polls that were released showed Graham comfortably ahead, with many voters unfamiliar with Harrison.</p><p>However, this dynamic had changed considerably by late summer.&#160;</p><p>A Quinnipiac poll <a href=\"https://poll.qu.edu/south-carolina/release-detail?ReleaseID=3670\">released in early August</a> revealed a tied race, with Harrison and Graham both garnering 44% of the vote. In late September, <a href=\"https://today.yougov.com/topics/politics/articles-reports/2020/09/27/cbs-newsyougov-tight-race-lindsey-graham-south-car\">a CBS News/YouGov poll revealed</a> a close race, with Graham holding a 1% lead (45%-44%). <a href=\"https://poll.qu.edu/south-carolina/release-detail?ReleaseID=3677\">The most recent Quinnipiac University poll</a>, also from late September, showed the race tied once again, with Harrison and Graham both receiving 48% of the vote from a pool of 1,123 likely voters.</p><p>As a result, the nonpartisan Cook Political Report <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/analysis/senate/south-carolina-senate/south-carolina-senate-moves-toss\">shifted the race</a> from \"Lean Republican\" to \"Toss Up\" in early October.&#160;Jessica Taylor, the Senate and Governors editor at the Cook Report, wrote that the change demonstrated \"just how fast the GOP majority is slipping away if they have to defend turf like this, and also how much Trump's numbers have fallen across the board.\"</p><p>Another nonpartisan forecaster, <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-senate/\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"e341714c1d4fa0efab2ead444e73fcdb\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics,</a> currently classifies the contest as \"leans Republican.\"</p><h2>Spending Spree</h2><p>The race has brought unprecedented levels of fundraising to the Palmetto State.</p><p>On Sunday, Harrison's campaign announced that they raised $57 million in the third quarter of 2020, a historic amount for a Senate candidate, <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/10/11/jaime-harrison-shatters-senate-fundraising-record-for-south-carolina-race-428541\">according to Politico</a>. Harrison shattered the $38.1 million quarterly record set in 2018 by then-Rep. Beto O'Rourke of Texas in his bid against Republican Sen. Ted Cruz.</p><p>In total, Harrison has raised roughly $86 million for his campaign, while Graham raised about $30 million through June, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-senate-elections-jaime-harrison-beto-orourke-ted-cruz-3303a77121ae9df9bb37df94dcc66bf8\">according to the Associated Press</a>. Graham has not released his third quarter figures yet.</p><p>\"This campaign is making history, because we're focused on restoring hope back to South Carolina,\" Harrison campaign spokesman Guy King said in a statement.</p><p>In September, the huge sums of cash being poured into the race led Graham <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QlvfT_SfXY4\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"ba11813aac6183e50ddaa9d509a71b27\">to make an appeal</a> to supporters on Fox News, where he said that he \"was getting killed financially\" by Harrison, who he predicted \"would raise $100 million.\"</p><p>Graham's camp said that the closeness of the race was attributable to out-of-state donations.</p><p>\"Liberal Democrats from across the country have poured record-breaking amounts of money into South Carolina because of Senator Graham's conservative record of accomplishment,\" Graham campaign Communications Director T.W. Arrighi said in a statement.</p><h2>The Final Weeks</h2><p>For most of 2020, Harrison has held the majority of his campaign events virtually, while Graham has generally conducted in-person events throughout the state. When both men met for their first televised debate at Allen University in Columbia, South Carolina, in early October, Harrison <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jaime-harrison-uses-plexiglass-partition-at-lindsey-graham-debate-2020-10\">used a plexiglass partition</a> to shield himself from Graham.</p><p>\"Tonight I am taking this [the coronavirus] seriously,\" Harrison said during the debate. \"That's why I put this plexiglass up. Because it's not just about me — it's about the people in my life that I have to take care of as well. My two boys, my wife, my grandmother.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f84a3acc255d800190b960f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"harrison-graham-debate\" height=\"2354\" width=\"3537\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jaime Harrison, left, and Sen. Lindsey Graham, right, prepare for their first debate at Allen University in Columbia, S.C.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Meg Kinnard</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Ahead of last week's second televised debate, Graham declined to take a COVID-19 test, despite his exposure to Trump and at least two other US senators who all tested positive for the disease. The debate format <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/lindsey-graham-refuses-covid-test-harrison-debate-forces-format-change-n1242805\">was quickly changed</a> from an in-person meeting to two individualized candidate forums.</p><p>Harrison is making Graham's lack of urgency regarding the coronavirus pandemic a major issue of the campaign.</p><p>\"There are a lot of people who liked Lindsey because they thought he could get things done,\" Harrison told Business Insider. \"He brings up the Supreme Court. I don't think that's going to help Lindsey win. How does that address how COVID has impacted the lives of people?\"</p><p>\"We all want the American dream,\" he said. \"You need a senator who is sympathetic to what is going on.\"</p><p>If Graham wins reelection, he will likely claim a mandate for conservatism. But if Harrison captures the seat, it will reflect a new chapter in a new American South.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/jaime-harrison-lindsey-graham-south-carolina-senate-election-polls-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aZWxUdR68vU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 13:25:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f843169642e9400180b54a6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5ec19f9751a85919ea34879e47437a3f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn39@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-37-660_1d90ebeeff6037ff.webp","destWidth":3417,"destHeight":2563,"sourceBytes":815182,"destBytes":815182,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f810ffabab422001979a945?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn90@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-18-839_905d754c078fdc65.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f811aefbab422001979a94f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn7@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-27-922_b932c1b9a619d985.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f843373bab422001979aba1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn23@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-27-024_8effcc1712782163.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f84a3acc255d800190b960f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn64@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-22-677_92cc4e368f95d919.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn8@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-36-739_e7ff763a3daf6b05.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn83@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-23-985_1c1b02d4b0a5a8fb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=aZWxUdR68vU:OhiLhkrY2Yg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-31-740_4b151548afcfe543.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/aZWxUdR68vU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn40@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-30-964_c7f4db1cc2a77f9b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520896},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"10 habits of strong professionals who aren't concerned with what other people think","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/habits-of-professionals-who-arent-concerned-what-other-people-think-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0c818f3f73701540662bc9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coworkers shaking hands\" height=\"1415\" width=\"1887\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Confident professionals don&#39;t  let others overshadow or diminish their success.\n<p class=\"copyright\">filadendron/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/amy-morin\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"fa86f4bd4d935d709a1e8684bd64a05c\">Amy Morin</a>&#160;is a psychotherapist, licensed clinical social worker, mental strength coach, and international bestselling author.</li>\n<li>She says she works to help people be confident in making their own choices and career decisions, even if coworkers or family members disapprove.</li>\n<li>Morin says mentally strong people let go of people who don't support them, establish personal and professional boundaries, and ignore unsolicited advice.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>One of my coaching clients recently decided to give up his high paying corporate job so he could live in an RV and start a blog.</p><p>While his new lifestyle might not sound too outrageous to many modern-day entrepreneurs, his colleagues and loved ones were shocked by his radical lifestyle shift. Their criticism caught him off guard, and caused him to second guess his decision.</p><p>He reached out to me, a mental strength coach, because he was concerned they might be right — was he experiencing some sort of life crisis?</p><p>Fortunately, he wasn't having a midlife crisis. He was redesigning his life to be more in line with his values. And if he was comfortable with his choices, it was OK if his friends and family disapproved.</p><p>Our sessions involved helping him see that he could be a kind and caring person without being a people-pleaser. He could choose his career and live life on his own terms without caring if everyone approved — and that made him mentally strong, not unkind.</p><p>Here are 10 habits of mentally strong professionals who aren't concerned with what other people think:</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">1. They let go of people who aren't interested in them</strong></h2><p>Whether they were ghosted after a third date or their old roommate stops returning their calls, you won't catch a mentally strong person begging anyone to stay in their lives. They don't compromise their values in an attempt to be liked nor do they wish anyone harm if they choose to leave.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">2. They express their emotions in healthy ways</strong></h2><p>Mentally strong people are willing to say things that might not sound cool, like, \"I'm nervous about this,\" or \"I'm sad that this is ending.\" Even when their feelings aren't shared by those around them, they're willing to express their emotions in a healthy way.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">3. They respectfully share their opinions</strong></h2><p>They don't agree with others just to keep the peace. Instead, mentally strong people are willing to share their opinions, but they do so in a respectful way. They're open-minded enough to respect people who don't share their opinions and bold enough to speak their truth.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">4. They use empowering language</strong></h2><p>You won't hear a mentally strong person apologize for taking up space or beg for a chance to speak. But you will hear them use empowering language that exudes confidence in themselves. So rather than say, \"I'm so sorry I won't be able to make it,\" they're more likely to say, \"Thank you for the invitation but I am not able to attend.\"</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">5. They establish healthy boundaries</strong></h2><p>Mentally strong people know it's up to them to set the rules on how they want to be treated. When people violate those rules — whether it's a friend who doesn't pay them back or it's a coworker who is patronizing — they speak up and protect their boundaries.&#160;</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">6. They show all sides of themselves</strong></h2><p>While they don't necessarily talk to their boss the exact same way as they speak to their old college buddies, mentally strong people don't change who they are just to make other people feel more comfortable.</p><p>They're comfortable in their own skin and aren't afraid to show that they're multi-dimensional people who can appreciate many different things in life.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">7. They experiment</strong></h2><p>They don't confine themselves to certain labels in life — like \"artistic\" or \"shy.\" They're not afraid to experiment with new things, explore new career paths, and meet new people. They know they can grow, change, and become whomever they choose to be over time.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">8. They use empowering language</strong></h2><p>Mentally strong people apologize when they've hurt someone. But they don't apologize for being human and they don't insist they're sorry just to prevent someone from getting upset.</p><p>They're much more likely to say things like, \"I appreciate your patience,\" rather than, \"I'm so sorry it took me four hours to reply to your email.\" They give themselves permission to be imperfect and use language that empowers them to feel worthy.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">9. They ignore unsolicited advice</strong></h2><p>Mentally strong people don't waste their time arguing with trolls on social media or worrying about criticism from people who don't know them. They turn to their trusted advisors in life when they need guidance, and tune out the unsolicited advice that comes their way.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">10. They own their success</strong></h2><p>While it can feel uncomfortable to hear compliments, mentally strong people are willing to accept them. Rather than minimize positive feedback by saying, \"Oh, it was nothing,\" they own their success. They acknowledge their hard work and effort, and aren't afraid to talk about their skills and talents.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/habits-of-professionals-who-arent-concerned-what-other-people-think-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Lda-FHOM90E\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 13:00:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f0c818f3f73701540662bc9?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"b7b419d7165c943152e2c98e574cce48","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-03-307_5531638deeae5604.webp","destWidth":1887,"destHeight":1415,"sourceBytes":127668,"destBytes":127668,"author":"insider@insider.com (Amy Morin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f0c818f3f73701540662bc9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-03-307_5531638deeae5604.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn64@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-32-125_71f22eb6ec903726.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn31@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-25-396_1507bf7b21d76826.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Lda-FHOM90E:JHoDuLkwVYM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-36-524_f0be1c2533c4ddb5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Lda-FHOM90E":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn8@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-18-458_e105eeba2dbad17f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520900},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"The Tesla trade is the best way to invest in a solution to global warming","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-trade-invest-in-a-solution-to-global-warming-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f64c098323fc4001e0d7119?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3_8\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Tesla Model 3 is one of four vehicles Tesla is selling.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The green economy looks set to grow in the coming decade, as governments and businesses strive to address global warming.</li>\n<li>At the moment, it's hard to have enough expertise to invest in the opportunity, given how complicated it is.</li>\n<li>Tesla, however, is directly involved in the green sector because it builds and sells only green technologies.</li>\n<li>As a result, it looks like a nice, easy way to do some green investing.</li>\n<li>And Tesla has a track record: investors who bought and held shares after the 2010 IPO have seen a 9,200% return.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Investing in the green economy is tricky, mainly because environmentally-responsible investments are still fairly esoteric, to people who aren't professionals or committed to doing a lot of research.</p><p>The opportunity is set to grow over the next decade, although the rate of that development is open for debate. If Joe Biden wins the Presidential election in November and the Democrats take the Senate and hold the House, a program of global-warming-fighting legislation could be the biggest story of 2021.</p><p>Outside the US, green opportunities are also picking up. In Europe, both the giant Volkswagen Group and Mercedes-Benz parent Daimler are committing to widespread electrification of new vehicles, anticipating regulatory changes that could spell the beginning of the end for gas-burning cars and trucks.</p><p>Meanwhile, in China, most automakers expect the coming decade to bring market growth that could make the country the world's leader in electrified transportation.</p><p>If you want to invest in this changeover, however, your best bet could be Tesla.&#160;</p><h2>Tesla has a track record and has shed risk in the past year</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6baf59e3e7670011716300?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elon Musk\" height=\"1763\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla CEO Elon Musk has become a multi-billionaire due to Tesla stock appreciation.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Odd Andersen/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>First, Tesla has a track record of rewarding investors. If you'd bought shares after the company's 2010 IPO, you'd be sitting on a 9,200% return today. And that's if you'd simply used your own money. If you'd bought with leverage, even at a relatively high rate of interest, the prospective amplified return is staggering.</p><p>This all happened with Tesla minting risk at a furious clip, with the stock pitching up and down like a dinghy in a hurricane, and CEO Elon Musk's Twitter habit adding to the chaos. It also happened when Tesla was operating essentially one factory, selling one or two models at a time, struggling to validate a home-solar business, and delivering fewer than 500,000 cars a year.</p><p>Over the next couple of years, Tesla should cross that 500,000 mark, have four assembly plants online (a new US factory in Texas could join the flagship in California, as well as a plant in China and one under construction in Germany). Tesla could also be operating several battery factories by then.</p><p>The valley of mega-risk has been crossed, and because the company sells nothing but green technologies, buying shares is the obvious way to invest in a global warming solution. I'm not saying you should, mind you — just that the strategy is obvious.</p><h2>Risky startups and risky traditional automakers</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e600696fee23d68b900fef2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GM EV Barra\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>GM has major electric ambitions, as CEO Mary Barra detailed in early 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">GM</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Other electric-car startups like Rivian, Nikola, and Lucid Motors are far riskier because they haven't brought vehicles to market yet. On the other hand, their shares, if and when they go public, should be cheaper.</p><p>What about established automakers with electric ambitions?&#160;</p><p>Investment professionals have been arguing for years that General Motors, now aiming to produce 22 new electrified vehicles by 2023, is horribly undervalued. But the play there is perhaps to buy GM stock with the hope that the company decides to spin off its electric business, something Wall Street has agitated for but that GM's management has been avoiding.</p><p>Tesla was starting to look pretty expensive after a huge rally at the beginning of the year took shares above $2,000. But a five-for-one stock split in August has brought shares back into reach.&#160;</p><p>Remember, the point here isn't that you're buying an electric automaker or a solar-panel manufacturer. You'd have to think hard about that, as carmakers are great at incinerating capital and, if you survey the sector, it's tough to find anything that's outperformed the markets (save Ferrari). Solar has a history of countries such as China flooding the market with cheap panels and turning the business into a low-margin commodity-like affair.</p><p>The point is that you want to invest in the emergence of a future green economy, and you want to do it without having to sort through green bond funds or socially-responsible ETFs or delving into the complexities of carbon-credit trading.</p><h2>Investing in one company and one stock rather than in an entire sector</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f888d689e9fe40019009910?format=jpeg\" alt=\"TSLA Chart\" height=\"846\" width=\"1944\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla has delivered a huge return to investors.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Markets Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Tesla offers a straightforward way to do this, with enough risk still embedded in the business to make a substantial return a possibility while not weighing down the opportunity with so much risk that you'd be tempted to bail out if the stock takes a nosedive at some point in the next five years.</p><p>On the other hand, putting all your eggs in one basket carries its own risk. You clearly aren't hedging by investing in the entire sector, taking advantage of broad ingenuity and discounted prices for companies that haven't really broken cover yet.</p><p>I should point out that I've never owned a single share of Tesla.&#160;And to be honest, I'd doubt I'd buy shares of Tesla if journalistic best practices didn't bar me from doings so. I think there are better companies to invest in outside the transportation industry that have more solid revenue and profitability prospects and that aren't attractive due to big swings in their stock prices.&#160;</p><p>However, if you think the future could be greener than the past or present, and you want to wager a few bucks on your hunch, Tesla appears to be one of the best ways to invest in a single company that's representative of the developing green economy.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a DeBord)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f64c098323fc4001e0d7119?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn55@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-22-644_b511f37be309f05e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6baf59e3e7670011716300?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-31-119_3bf64ac9430328d8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e600696fee23d68b900fef2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn11@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-25-978_ed9d8f65e4f05d3b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f888d689e9fe40019009910?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn68@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-32-067_06226cf9cdc57e5c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=OzKsQ3594Hs:RIiAmEFLNQ4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-34-569_05e4a538afc03341.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=OzKsQ3594Hs:RIiAmEFLNQ4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-31-802_b7d2481454399b8a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=OzKsQ3594Hs:RIiAmEFLNQ4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn91@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-30-721_04feb06c2d64f22d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/OzKsQ3594Hs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-18-773_c869a4afda6a403f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520919},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Pelosi's office says the latest coronavirus stimulus talk with Mnuchin had 'encouraging news on testing'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-latest-stimulus-talk-with-mnuchin-had-encouraging-news-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f817fae642e9400180b527f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"House Speaker Nancy Pelosi\" height=\"750\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is meeting with White House officials to hash out a deal on another coronavirus rescue package.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Liz Lynch/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Some \"encouraging news on testing\" came out of the latest discussion between House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin on the coronavirus stimulus package.&#160;</li>\n<li>The second stimulus package remains stalled in Congress as Republicans and Democrats deadlock on the size of the plan.</li>\n<li>Pelosi and Mnuchin spoke Saturday evening, according to Drew Hammill, the house speaker's deputy of chief.</li>\n<li>\"While there was some encouraging news on testing, there remains work to do to ensure there is a comprehensive testing plan that includes contact tracing and additional measures to address the virus' disproportionate impact on communities of color,\" Hammill said.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's office said Saturday evening that there were some \"encouraging news on testing\" in the latest round of discussions surrounding the next coronavirus stimulus package.</p><p>Pelosi spoke with Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin Saturday evening, according to Drew Hammill, deputy chief of staff at the speaker's office.</p><p>\"While there was some encouraging news on testing, there remains work to do to ensure there is a comprehensive testing plan that includes contact tracing and additional measures to address the virus' disproportionate impact on communities of color,\" Hammill tweeted.</p><p>\"There remains an array of additional differences as we go provision by provision that must be addressed in a comprehensive manner in the next 48 hours,\" Hammill continued.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Drew Hammill  (@Drew_Hammill) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317650979429470210?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 18, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The next stimulus package remains stalled in Congress, as Democrats and Republicans continue to hammer out the details of the plan. House Democrats <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-democrats-stimulus-plan-congress-unemployment-economy-pass-vote-bill-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"f4442d4ffa580050ae866c585641882c\">passed a $2.2 trillion stimulus plan</a> earlier this month, but Sen. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-rips-into-democratic-stimulus-plan-congress-outlandish-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"505f23b4334e4727c934fa04ea18a20f\">called the amount \"outlandish\"</a> and said the two parties remain \"very, very far apart on a deal.\"</p><p>The White House has also proposed its own <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nancy-pelosi-white-house-stimulus-offer-deficiencies-republican-criticism-checks-2020-10\">$1.8 trillion plan</a>, which includes $1,200 direct payments, a $400 weekly federal unemployment benefit, $300 billion in aid to state and local governments, and some funding for virus testing and contact tracing.</p><p>Lawmakers were quick to point out the plan's deficiencies, with Pelosi saying in a <a href=\"https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/101320\">letter to House Democrats</a> that the parameters for expanded nationwide testing and tracing program are not well-defined.</p><p>\"The Administration continues to refuse to put a national testing, tracing and surveillance plan in place,\" said New Jersey Rep. Frank Pallone in the letter. \"[The Trump plan] would also needlessly delay funding to states by requiring states to jump through legislative hoops that are simply unnecessary. It does nothing to address the barriers and needs of communities of color that have been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/15/mnuchin-says-hell-give-ground-on-virus-testing-in-stimulus-negotiations-with-pelosi.html\">Mnuchin, however, said earlier this week on CNBC</a> that the lack of agreement on testing will not derail the coronavirus stimulus package.</p><p>\"That issue is getting overblown,\" Mnuchin said. \"We've agreed to $178 billion overall for health. It's an extraordinary amount of money. We'd agreed with the Democrats with $75 billion going to testing, contact tracing.\"</p><p>\"What we have been focused on is the language around testing,\" Mnuchin said, adding that the White House will not \"let the testing issue stand in the way.\"</p><p>Meanwhile, the Republicans are still rejecting the large plans proposed by both the House Democrats and the White House, urging instead for a significantly smaller package in the <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/15/mnuchin-says-hell-give-ground-on-virus-testing-in-stimulus-negotiations-with-pelosi.html\">amount of $500 billion</a>.</p><p>The White House did not immediately return Business Insider's request for comment.</p><p>The coronavirus has infected more than 8.1 million people in the United States, according to the latest data compiled by Johns Hopkins University. Of that, more than 219,000 people have died.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Dzhanova)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f817fae642e9400180b527f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-25-050_ee7f34fb4cf00263.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zDkSNVLa4yQ:MwS-ticsD8w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn26@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-30-955_3d4572943770930f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zDkSNVLa4yQ:MwS-ticsD8w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn75@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-36-530_a7127fc3132e27a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zDkSNVLa4yQ:MwS-ticsD8w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn92@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-31-201_9571ce5ac133cc27.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zDkSNVLa4yQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn60@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-22-744_3d60e27516b104a4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520892},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"I tried Red Lobster's viral Mountain Dew 'Dewgarita' and it was a real-life monstrosity","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/i-tried-red-lobsters-viral-mountain-dew-margarita-awful-2020-10","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Red Lobster is offering a limited-release of its \"Dewgarita\" at select restaurants this month. The seafood chain promises a wide-release by the end of the year.</li>\n<li>The alcoholic Mountain Dew drink is taking the internet by storm as people gawk at the nuclear-colored concoction.</li>\n<li>I tried the new margarita and was disappointed by its lack of Mountain Dew and overall flavor.</li>\n<li>Many food chains are debuting bizarre creations that they hope will lure customers in, but I think they'll have to try a little bit harder to make something actually good if they want them to keep coming back.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><ol><li><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d6d89e9fe40019009ceb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"4608\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li></ol><p>In a collaboration that puts even the weirdest cafeteria dare to shame, Pepsi and Red Lobster are rolling out a new drink known as the \"Dewgarita.\"&#160;</p><p>The green, alcoholic concoction is one part Mountain Dew, one part tequila, but mostly, it's a head-scratching viral talker that has piqued the curiosities of millennial social media.&#160;</p><p>As the seafood chain endures its \"most challenging time,\" due to mandatory shutdowns and limited dine-in services, the company is exploring \"strategic options\" as it tries to keep its doors open despite sale losses, <a href=\"https://www.fsrmagazine.com/chain-restaurants/red-lobster-taps-adviser-explore-strategic-options-report-says\">according to FSR Magazine.</a></p><p>It appears the absurd, $10 Mountain Dew and margarita mixture may be a move to boost foot traffic as restaurants nationwide rely on alcohol sales and the growing popularity of to-go cocktails to supplement their losses.</p><p>I ventured to my nearest Red Lobster to see if the Dewgarita is worth the shock-value hype.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tI sat down at the restaurant's bar, aptly called \"Bar Harbor.\" It was very exclusive and had only three seats due to social distancing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797eb282c500018c7868d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLike any good American, when the bartender came over and asked me what I wanted to order, there were only two things on my mind: Dewgarita and warm, cheddar biscuits.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ea282c500018c7868c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tShe quickly shook up the drink for me in the back and set the nuclear-green margarita in front of me.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797eb2400440019129c8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor a drink that's gained internet notoriety for its \"Mountain Dew\"-schtick, I was surprised by the underwhelming flavor from my first sip.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ed282c500018c78690?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI asked the bartender what was in the Dewgarita, which she revealed was a sour-apple liquor, tequila, and a two-ounce pinch of Mountain Dew.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ec282c500018c7868f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"2316\" width=\"3088\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNo quenching fizziness that I crave from soda. No sugar explosion that makes Mountain Dew a guilty pleasure.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797f0282c500018c78694?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe drink was more like a sad, watered-down margarita you get from a backyard party.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ee282c500018c78691?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI took a sip of the drink from the rim, which the bartender described as a red sugar-mixture made just for the Dewgarita.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ed2400440019129c91?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt didn't make anything better. My brain expected something spicy, which would have at least provided some flavor.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797f0282c500018c78692?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhile the taste of the drink was disappointing, on the bright side, I was very appreciative of the amount of tequila in it.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ed2400440019129c92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd if you pretend that you paid $10 for the free cheddar biscuits, rather than falling for a marketing strategy, your pocketbook feels just a little bit better.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797f0282c500018c78693?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI asked a manager how many people had ordered the drink so far. He said, three.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ec282c500018c7868e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThat sounds about right.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797f0282c500018c78695?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe inherent humor of getting to say, \"I tried a Mountain Dew Margarita at Red Lobster\" could draw people to the chain, but the taste and price won't bring them back.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d4ead260780019341e0d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster mountain dewgarita Linh Ta/Business Insider\" height=\"2666\" width=\"3555\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf the seafood chain wants to keep curious customers coming back for more, its other promised drink collaborations with PepsiCo need to offer more than just a funny name.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d5369e9fe40019009ce2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster mountain dewgarita Linh Ta/Business Insider\" height=\"2666\" width=\"3555\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt needs to offer better flavors, and be more reminiscent of the soda its invoking, rather than just a half-hearted effort at producing a similar color.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d6589e9fe40019009ce9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Linh Ta/ Business Insider\" height=\"2666\" width=\"3555\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/ Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOtherwise, I can just save my $10 and buy a two-liter Mountain Dew and cheap tequila instead.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7797ec2400440019129c90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Red Lobster Mountain Dewgarita review\" height=\"3456\" width=\"5184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Linh Ta/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a blishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520909},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Porsche created a huge EV charging truck that can recharge 10 Porsche Taycans at once — see how it works","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/porsches-electric-vehicle-charging-truck-recharge-10-taycans-at-once-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a02a857b7da001ee1302f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\" height=\"1406\" width=\"1875\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\" target=\"_blank\">Porsche</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Porsche created an electric vehicle charging truck that can recharge 10 Porsche Taycans at once, and 30 total.</li>\n<li>The charging truck has a power rating of 3.2 megawatts with its 2.1-megawatt hour battery system.</li>\n<li>Porsche currently has seven of these chargers on wheels that have been used at various \"customer driving experiences\" and events.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\">Porsche created</a> a mobile electric vehicle charging truck that can recharge 10 Taycans at once.</p><p>The Taycan —&#160;which starts at <a href=\"https://www.porsche.com/usa/models/taycan/taycan-models/taycan-4s/\">$103,800</a> — is the German automaker's flagship, first fully electric sports car with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/porsche-taycan-coolest-features-in-production-car-2019-9\">features and specs</a> that aren't found in other electric vehicles on the market.</p><p>With the introduction of a hallmark car comes driving events and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/porsche\">Porsche's</a> \"customer driving programs,\" which the Taycan has now become an \"integral\" component of, <a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\">according to the automaker</a>. However, several of these events have been held in locations that don't have a strong enough infrastructure to support the quick recharge of several electric sports cars at once.</p><p>As a result, the automaker, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.ads-tec.de/en/company/about-us.html\">Ads-Tec</a> — a German hardware and software creator that specializes in \"industrial\" use — has developed a mobile charging unit that can repower several Taycans at once.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe charging truck has a power rating of 3.2 megawatts with its 2.1-megawatt hour battery systems. This allows 10 Taycans to be charged rapidly at once for a total of 30 vehicle recharges until the unit itself needs juice again.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a02e1323fc4001e0d7ac4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\" target=\"_blank\">Porsche</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe trailer has been tested at several events across Europe, completing 5,000 \"charging operations\" in various environments, including some in freezing conditions.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a026b57b7da001ee1302a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\" height=\"1407\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\" target=\"_blank\">Porsche</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn line with the eco friendliness of electric vehicles, the trailer can be recharged in four hours using sustainable energy, like solar.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a03f1323fc4001e0d7ad0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\" height=\"1406\" width=\"1875\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Porsche Taycan.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\" target=\"_blank\">Porsche</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPorsche currently has seven of these charging trucks in its lineup.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a040a57b7da001ee13047?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\" height=\"1406\" width=\"1875\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Porsche&#39;s mobile charging truck.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.porsche.com/en/2020/company/porsche-high-power-charging-trucks-mobile-power-sources-22285.html\" target=\"_blank\">Porsche</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8b550b9e9fe40019009f3c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e33467caccf5bd5b422a19ae271774c7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn46@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-21-260_d8ae6e89af8ff964.webp","destWidth":1875,"destHeight":1406,"sourceBytes":389414,"destBytes":389414,"author":"bchang@businessinsider.com (Brittany Chang)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f6a02a857b7da001ee1302f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-16-950_89299275b72ae389.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6a02e1323fc4001e0d7ac4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn65@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-16-983_9ba424ae262aa9af.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6a026b57b7da001ee1302a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-35-797_4a6516f000916254.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6a03f1323fc4001e0d7ad0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-23-753_697dbcf081b58023.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6a040a57b7da001ee13047?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-34-770_673dde6a10d9e126.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7ihK8VQ77p8:e4H_VaIgJaA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn16@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-26-265_64bab1870199b5ce.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7ihK8VQ77p8:e4H_VaIgJaA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn95@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-19-998_65f0651d59c04163.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7ihK8VQ77p8:e4H_VaIgJaA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-20-390_60cbfa6f8a44556d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7ihK8VQ77p8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn80@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-28-381_1764943583c03829.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520935},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Warren Buffett plowed $5 billion into Bank of America during the debt crisis. Here's the story of how the investor helped the bank and made a fortune in the process.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-invested-5-billion-bank-of-america-made-fortune-2020-10","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc0989a695b583bcf26ec02?format=jpeg\" alt=\"warren buffett\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong / Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Warren Buffett invested $5 billion in Bank of America in August 2011, providing a crucial vote of confidence and cash cushion to the struggling lender.</strong></li><li><strong>The famed investor and Berkshire Hathaway CEO had the idea to invest while taking a bath, and was initially blocked by a call-center worker before getting through to Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan.</strong></li><li><strong>The pair signed a deal within 24 hours that centered on Berkshire receiving preferred shares and stock warrants in exchange for its cash.</strong></li><li><strong>Berkshire exercised the warrants in 2017 and covered the cost by redeeming its preferred shares, giving it a stake worth more than triple its initial investment.</strong></li><li><strong>Bank of America remains Berkshire's most-valuable holding after Apple.</strong></li><li><strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/international?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></strong></li></ul><hr><p>Warren Buffett plowed $5 billion into Bank of America during the US sovereign-debt crisis in 2011, shoring up confidence in the embattled lender and striking one of the most lucrative deals of his career.</p><p>Here's the story of how the billionaire investor and Berkshire Hathaway CEO stepped in to help one of America's biggest banks and made a fortune in the process.</p><h2>A bathtub, a call center, and a billion-dollar deal</h2><p>Buffett was taking a bath in late August 2011, reflecting on his investments in American Express and Geico during difficult periods for both companies, when he had the idea to bet on Bank of America, <a href=\"https://fortune.com/2011/08/29/buffetts-bank-of-america-deal-dreamed-up-in-the-tub/\">Fortune reported</a>.</p><p>The investor tried to get through to the bank's CEO, Brian Moynihan, but was initially blocked by a call-center worker.</p><p>\"Warren asked to speak to me and of course they don't transfer everybody who calls the call centers to the CEO's line,\" Moynihan told David Rubenstein <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2019-10-09/how-warren-buffett-got-through-to-bank-of-america-ceo-brian-moynihan-video\">in a Bloomberg interview last year</a>.</p><p>Buffett eventually got through to Moynihan and proposed an investment in his company. Moynihan replied that Bank of America didn't need the capital.</p><p>\"I know, that's why I'm calling,\" Buffett responded, adding that accepting his money would provide stability, a stamp of approval, and a cash cushion.</p><p>Moynihan concurred, and the pair signed a deal less than 24 hours after speaking for the first time. Buffett's cash hit Bank of America's account a couple of days later.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-small-companies-recommendations-high-upside-rbc-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Buy these 7 unheralded stocks right now for near-term upside of at least 25% as growth accelerates to a new level, RBC says</a></em></p><h2>Warren got his warrants</h2><p>Buffett and Moynihan agreed that Berkshire would hand $5 billion in cash to Bank of America, in exchange for $5 billion worth of preferred shares, redeemable at a 5% premium and paying a 5% annual dividend.</p><p>Berkshire also received stock warrants giving it the right to buy 700 million of the bank's common shares at a price of $7.14 per share. The warrants could be exercised at any point over the next 10 years.</p><p>The deal terms echoed Buffett's bailouts of Goldman Sachs and General Electric during the 2008 financial crisis. The investor demanded preferred stock and warrants in those cases too.</p><p>Buffett outlined his rationale for betting on Bank of America in his&#160;<a href=\"https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/letters/2011ltr.pdf\">2011 shareholder letter</a>.</p><p>\"Some huge mistakes were made by prior management,\" he said. \"Brian Moynihan has made excellent progress in cleaning these up.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-strategy-4-stocks-to-buy-market-leaders-nancy-zevenbergen-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nancy Zevenbergen is in the top 1% of investors over the past 5 years. She breaks down what she looks for in young companies — and shares 4 stocks she thinks could be market leaders 10 years from now.</a></em></p><p>The bank chief was \"nurturing a huge and attractive underlying business that will endure long after today's problems are forgotten,\" Buffett continued, adding that Berkshire's warrants \"will likely be of great value before they expire.\"</p><p>The investor waited to use the warrants until the dividends from 700 million of the bank's common shares exceeded the $300 million in yearly income from the preferred stock.</p><p>He exercised all of them in August 2017, and covered the $5 billion cost of doing so by surrendering virtually all of Berkshire's preferred shares.</p><p>Berkshire's common shares were worth over $20 billion at the end of 2017 - more than triple the cost of its initial investment, even before accounting for the dividends it received.</p><p>Buffett has boosted the position to more than 1 billion shares since then. Berkshire is the bank's biggest shareholder, while Bank of America is its second-largest holding after Apple.</p><p>The investor has been chasing another \"eureka\" moment ever since.</p><p>\"I've spent a lot of time in the bathtub since and nothing's come to me,\" he said at Berkshire's annual shareholder meeting in 2017.</p><p>\"Clearly, I either need a new bathtub or we got to get to a different kind of market.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-expert-sees-us-transitioning-to-insolvency-phase-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">'I'm extremely concerned': A former Goldman Sachs hedge-fund chief says a flood of troubling signals shows the stock market is teetering — and warns a small correction could soon morph into something much larger</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-invested-5-billion-bank-of-america-made-fortune-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=trj4ac4YIU4:Xp4JhUHpNgM:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img
