need.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0699323fc4001e0d7b0f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to Stevens, a typical design process for a client-requested build can take over two months.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0687323fc4001e0d7b0d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1874\" design was finalized in a few weeks.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a04eb57b7da001ee13065?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Dark Horse’s bright interior and single level was designed to “appeal to as broad an audience as possible.”\n\t<figure>\n\t<img double, the home is more accessible for those who can't walk up stairs or climb up ladders.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a061d57b7da001ee13079?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd according to Stevens, this work has paid off: Build Tiny has already seen a \"huge amount of interest\" in the Dark Horse.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0537323fc4001e0d7af8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t“There are tens of thousands of New Zealanders returning home due to the pandemic, and that's on top of an existing housing supply crisis here due to sustained population growth and an underinvestment in housing,” Stevens wrote. “There just aren't enough homes for all these returning Kiwis to live in, so more people than ever are now considering tiny homes as a viable option.”\n\t<figure>\n\t<img and 10.5 feet tall.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a06da57b7da001ee13088?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe interior is lined with windows, see through doors, and a deck to create an \"indoor outdoor\" feel, according to Build Tiny's YouTube video tour of the Dark Horse.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a067e57b7da001ee13080?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... that then lead into the overhead kitchen cabinet and LED strip light.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0668323fc4001e0d7b0b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" home.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a06e157b7da001ee13089?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe kitchen is split into two halves that run parallel to each other, but several of the appliances — specifically the refrigerator and microwave — need to be purchased separately with the \"extra appliance package,\" which also includes a washing machine.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0670323fc4001e0d7b0c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOne side of the kitchen has the pull-out trash and recycling disposal drawer, sink, dishwasher, and space for a microwave and refrigerator freezer …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a066157b7da001ee1307e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t… while the other half holds the dual gas cooktop with an overhead slide-out hood, magnetic backsplash to hold spices, gas oven, slide-out pantry, and breakfast bar.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a060357b7da001ee13078?format=jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPast the kitchen and its sliding door is the laundry and bathroom.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img wall-mounted drying rack, and washing machine if the \"extra appliance package\" is purchased.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a06ba323fc4001e0d7b12?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1872\" width=\"2496\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut for bathroom use, the space has a sink, mirror next to the windows, composting toilet, and standing shower with a shower dome.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a06a8323fc4001e0d7b10?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOn the opposite end of the tiny home is the bedroom, which comes with several storage units that surround the bed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0703323fc4001e0d7b1d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe bed itself can also lift up to reveal under-bed storage.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a04d757b7da001ee13063?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBesides the extra appliances, the tiny home can be upgraded to include an off-grid underfloor gas heater or an off-grid solar system.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0691323fc4001e0d7b0e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2499\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut otherwise, the Dark Horse comes with a power hookup point.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a06cc57b7da001ee13087?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"Most of the reputable tiny house builders like us have a pipeline of work extending well into 2021, so the fact that the Dark Horse tiny house is already built and ready to be delivered is very appealing to many,\" Stevens wrote.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a04cb323fc4001e0d7af2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe home — which will be available after October 17 — can be shipped internationally.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a0582323fc4001e0d7afc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dark Horse tiny home\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Dark Horse tiny home.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.buildtiny.co.nz/dark-horse\" target=\"_blank\">Build Tiny</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 8/17-02-30-166_12e7b977bfcab443.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qoTssuy5c9c:AqVbUdo6gfI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-25-752_dfaca7e305c7e38d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qoTssuy5c9c:AqVbUdo6gfI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn95@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-36-624_5a7b9c3cfb291b86.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/qoTssuy5c9c":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn61@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-34-611_8a25c9faf21f9588.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520941},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Eric Trump tried to make Biden look corrupt by sharing a picture of a palatial house he claims the Democrat lives in — but Biden sold it 24 years ago","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/eric-trump-shares-misleading-claim-about-old-joe-biden-property-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c1c169e9fe40019009f63?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Eric-Trump-2\" height=\"1994\" width=\"3988\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Eric Trump hosts a campaign event in Monroe, N.C., on Oct. 8, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Eric Trump on Saturday tweeted an image of an imposing property he claims Joe Biden owns and is possible evidence of corruption by the Democratic presidential nominee.&#160;</li>\n<li>\"The salary of a US Senator is $174,000 per year. This is Joe Biden's house.... seems legit,\" tweeted Trump, who is campaigning for his father, Donald Trump's, reelection.&#160;</li>\n<li>But fact-checking <a href=\"https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/biden-mansion-tweet/\">site Snopes</a> pointed out that Biden hasn't owned the property for 24 years, and had bought it for a bargain price of $185,000 in 1974 when it was derelict.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Eric Trump, the son of President Donald Trump, tweeted a picture of a sprawling property he claimed is owned by Joe Biden, evidence of corruption by the Democratic presidential nominee.&#160;</p><p>But it turns out that Biden hasn't owned the property for 24 years — having bought in 1974 at a bargain price and sold it on, fact-checking<a href=\"https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/biden-mansion-tweet/\">&#160;site Snopes found.&#160;</a></p><p>In the tweet, Trump, who is currently campaigning for his father's reelection, shared the image of the home in Wilmington, Delaware, with the message \"the salary of a U.S. Senator is $174,000 per year. This is Joe Biden's house.... seems legit.\"</p><p>The picture is an aerial shot of the 5 bedroom &#160;10,000-square-foot former DuPont mansion in the Greenville area of Wilmington.</p><p>But Snopes pointed out that Biden hasn't owned the property since 1996, when he sold it for $1.2 million.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.townandcountrymag.com/leisure/real-estate/a33809100/joe-biden-real-estate-homes/\">According to Town and Country</a>, Biden had bought the property in 1974 when still a junior senator, and shortly after the death of his first wife and infant daughter.</p><p>At the time the property was abandoned and needed significant renovations, and Biden paid $185,000 for it.&#160;</p><p>Biden has always placed his modest background at the core of his political persona.</p><p>He has campaigned on a pledge to help ordinary Americans whose lives have been damaged by the economic collapse caused by what he says is Trump's botched handling of the coronavirus.&#160;</p><p>Biden has always been interested in real estate, according to Town and Country, and \"began buying homes—especially those that were outside his budget—in his twenties, taking out multiple mortgages and receiving loans against life insurance policies.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/michelatindera/2019/08/28/joe-bidens-net-worth-how-the-2020-presidential-candidate-built-a-9-million-fortune/#3a6db9d4104d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">According to Forbes,</a>&#160;Biden is currently worth about $9 million, with much of the money earned through lucrative speaking gigs and other positions after serving as vice president. About $4 million of his wealth is tied up in properties.&#160;</p><p>On Twitter, critics were quick to point out the multiple falsehoods in Trump's tweet, highlighting that Biden hadn't served in the senate since 2008, following his appointed as vice president by Barack Obama.&#160;</p><p>\"Lol, this isn't Biden's house and he hasn't been a senator in 12 years?\" <a href=\"https://twitter.com/BillR/status/1317519717180018688?s=20\">tweeted Bill Russo</a>, a Biden campaign spokesman.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Eric Trump  (@EricTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317482157812613122?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 17, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>The Trump campaign did not immediately respond to a request for comment on criticism of Trump's tweet.</p><p>A Twitter spokesperson said that the site would not be taking any action with regards to the tweet, which remains on Eric Trump's feed at the time of publication, because it does not violate any of its policies.&#160;</p><p>In recent days the Trump campaign has seized on emails published in the New York Post, whose authenticity has been disputed, which the Post claims show evidence of Biden's son, Hunter's, corrupt business practices in Ukraine.</p><p>Biden has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-hunter-biden-new-york-post-donald-trump-disinformation-2020-10\">described the article as a \"smear campaign,\"</a> and US intelligence agencies are investigating whether information was leaked as part of a Russian disinformation campaign.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/eric-trump-shares-misleading-claim-about-old-joe-biden-property-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Porter)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8c1c169e9fe40019009f63?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn91@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-25-911_fcef1c069d9182f5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=QS8NuQB4FCs:8zGzYKO7Pb4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-23-921_eaf5fbe65572f2e0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=QS8NuQB4FCs:8zGzYKO7Pb4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn31@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-17-971_1a58ced5edfd4fec.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=QS8NuQB4FCs:8zGzYKO7Pb4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn35@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-24-541_c55602b5a13a2aff.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/QS8NuQB4FCs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-29-717_870d1756bf28ef2c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520927},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Pelosi said Democrats and Trump administration don't agree on language used in stalled coronavirus relief package","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-dems-and-trump-dont-agree-on-language-for-stimulus-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c50d5c21cfb0019468a6f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nancy Pelosi\" height=\"1289\" width=\"2578\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nancy Pelosi addressed the ongoing negotiations for a future COVID-19 relief package during an appearance Sunday on ABC&#39;s &#34;This Week.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">ABC This Week/Twitter</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Sunday said that Democrats in Congress and members of the Trump administration have been unable to reach a final agreement regarding a future COVID-19 relief package.</li>\n<li>While Pelosi said she was \"optimistic\" and the two parties have made progress, she said there have been specific disagreements over the language used in the bill.&#160;&#160;</li>\n<li>Pelosi said that members of the president's administration were not \"legislators\" and had removed about 55% of the language related to testing and contact tracing.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi on Sunday said she and members of President Donald Trump's administration have not yet been able to come to an agreement on the language used in an upcoming COVID-19 stimulus package, continuing the monthslong delay.</p><p>During an interview on ABC \"This Week\" on Sunday, Pelosi told moderator George Stephanopoulos that disagreements stem from issues related to the language used in the portion of the legislation that addresses testing and contact tracing.&#160;</p><p>\"We're seeking clarity,\" Pelosi said Sunday. \"Because actually, with all due respect to some of the people in the president's administration, they're not legislators. So when they said 'we are accepting the language on testing,' for example. 'We're just making a light touch,' they said. They changed 'shall' to 'may,' 'requirements' to 'recommendations,' 'a plan' to 'a strategy.'\"&#160;</p><p>Pelosi said the Trump administration had removed 55% of the language originally used in portions about testing and contact tracing.&#160;</p><p>\"The tracing part is so important because communities of color have been disproportionately affected by this,\" Pelosi added. \"On this subject where we have an agreement, we don't have an agreement in the language yet, but I'm hopeful.\"&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;This Week  (@ThisWeekABC) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1317816172117659649?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 18, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>As Business Insider previously reported, Pelosi's office on Saturday evening had <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-latest-stimulus-talk-with-mnuchin-had-encouraging-news-2020-10\">signaled progress on stimulus talks</a>, which have been monthslong and oftentimes contentious. At the beginning of the month, House Democrats <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-democrats-stimulus-plan-congress-unemployment-economy-pass-vote-bill-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"f4442d4ffa580050ae866c585641882c\">passed $2.2 trillion stimulus legislation</a>, but Sen. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-rips-into-democratic-stimulus-plan-congress-outlandish-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"505f23b4334e4727c934fa04ea18a20f\">called it \"outlandish\"</a> and signaled further disagreements on coming to a deal.</p><p>\"While there was some encouraging news on testing, there remains work to do to ensure there is a comprehensive testing plan that includes contact tracing and additional measures to address the virus' disproportionate impact on communities of color,\" Drew Hammill, the deputy chief of staff at the speaker's office, said in a tweet.</p><p>In a follow-up tweet Saturday, Hammill said that existing disagreements \"must be addressed in a comprehensive manner in the next 48 hours.\"</p><p>Pelosi on Saturday said she had been concerned about the changes made by the Trump administration officials to the language about how to address testing and training within minority communities, adding that it had been altered to allow states to come up with their own plans.</p><p>\"We had pages and pages of how you would do this in the minority community,\" she said. \"They crossed it all out.</p><p>\"We have to have a national plan,\" she added. \"You can't leave it up to the states to decide how they're going to address the minority community.\"&#160;</p><p>Pelosi told Stephanopoulos the 48-hour deadline only applied to get a deal passed before the election.</p><p>\"But we're saying we have to freeze the design on some of these things,\" the speaker said. \"Are we going with it or not? And what is the language? I'm optimistic because, again, we've been back and forth on all of this.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Donald Trump to open a new golf course named after his mother in Scotland despite opposition from conservationists and local residents","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-to-open-scottish-golf-course-named-after-his-mother-mary","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8bf5bcc21cfb0019468a51?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Donald Trump plays a round of golf after the opening of The Trump International Golf Links Course on July 10, 2012 in Balmedie, Scotland.\" height=\"3261\" width=\"4348\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Donald Trump plays a round of golf after the opening of The Trump International Golf Links Course on July 10, 2012 in Balmedie, Scotland.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The 18-hole course will be called \"MacLeod\" in honor of Trump's mother, Mary MacLeod, who was born and brought up on the Scottish island of Lewis and later emigrated to New York in 1930.</li>\n<li>A resort hotel with 450 rooms, a conference center, and spa will also be built on the site alongside 950-holiday apartments, up to 500 houses, and 36 golf villas and community facilities.</li>\n<li>Conservationists say that the new course could destroy the coastal sand dunes at nearby Foveran Links which are considered a special scientific interest (SSI) for their unusual shift patterns and biodiversity.</li>\n<li>Locals also objected to the application with concerns about the loss of public space and the impact the course would have on the likes of water supplies, private roads, and nearby estates.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Donald Trump is set to open a new, golf course in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, which will be named after his mother despite opposition from conservationists and local residents.&#160;</p><p>The 18-hole course will be called \"MacLeod\" in honor of Trump's mother, Mary MacLeod who was born and brought up on the Scottish island of Lewis and emigrated to New York when she was 17-years-old.&#160;</p><p>A resort hotel with 450 rooms, a conference center, and spa will also be built on the golf site alongside 950-holiday apartments, up to 500 houses, and 36 golf villas and community facilities, <a href=\"https://www.scotsman.com/news/politics/donald-trump-build-second-golf-course-scotland-despite-objections-3006952\">The Scotsman</a> reported.</p><p>The course will share a golf house and related facilities with the neighboring Trump International Golf Links on the Menie Estate which opened in 2012 but will provide an extra 141 parking spaces.&#160;</p><p>The construction of the original golf course was controversial due to the impact on coastal sand dunes at nearby Foveran Links&#160;which are considered a&#160;special scientific interest (SSSI) for their unusual shift patterns and biodiversity.</p><p>Conservationists say that the new course could cause the sand dunes to erode even further and last year, Scottish Natural Heritage recommended they be stripped of their SSSI title since they have been \"partially destroyed.\"</p><p>Trump pledged up to 6,000 jobs for local people as part of the original development by building a five-star hotel with 450 rooms, shops, a sports complex, timeshare flats, two golf courses, and housing estates.</p><p>It has not been profitable since it opened and a previous Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-lost-millions-on-golf-courses-tax-returns-report-2020-9?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">article</a> reported that the president has lost more than $315 million on his golf courses over the past 20 years.</p><p>It added that along with Trump Turnberry in Ayr, Scotland and Trump International Resort in Doonbeg, Ireland, Trump International Golf Links has had losses of&#160;around $63.6 million.</p><p>The president's decision to name the new course after his mother may surprise Trump-watchers. The mother-son relationship is shrouded in mystery. He tends to speak more about his father. Biographer Tim O'Brien told&#160;<a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2020/05/the-mystery-of-donald-trumps-mother\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Vanity Fair</a>&#160;that he remembered Trump would not voluntarily talk about her.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-stat/graphics/politics/trump-archive/docs/donald-trump-interview-with-marc-fisher-and-michael-kranish-april-21-2016.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" data-vars-item-name=\"BL-8037181-https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-stat/graphics/politics/trump-archive/docs/donald-trump-interview-with-marc-fisher-and-michael-kranish-april-21-2016.pdf\" data-vars-event-id=\"c6\">Despite describing her as \"fantastic\" and \"a homemaker,\" </a> it is his father's picture that sits in the Oval Office – not hers, reported the Independent.</p><p>Mary Trump was likewise reluctant to discuss their relationship. A 2017&#160;<a href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/donald-trump-mother-mary-relationship-what-have-i-created-psychology-macleod-fred-trump-a8037181.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Independent</a> article reported that she was very embarrassed by her son when his failing marriage and businesses were the focus of intense media scrutiny in the 80s.&#160;</p><p>She reportedly asked her then-daughter-in-law, \"what sort of son have I created?\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Bhardwaj)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8bf5bcc21cfb0019468a51?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn18@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-04-722_7ab82fab4a8fbf52.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JL-P0sNImKo:KnRQTbX2njY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn88@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-22-074_1535e939eb661413.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JL-P0sNImKo:KnRQTbX2njY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn47@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-35-404_de57ea93bab81b1a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JL-P0sNImKo:KnRQTbX2njY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-27-303_7b4d5ffee0515ba5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/JL-P0sNImKo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn15@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-30-818_bea0152573adc689.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520932},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"'Not out of the woods': Here's what 5 top executives said this week about the prospect of more economic stimulus","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/economic-outlook-executives-coronavirus-stimulus-deadlock-credit-risks-banks-airlines-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5038ace6ff30001d4e6c78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: The U.S. Capitol building exterior is seen at sunset as members of the Senate participate in the first day of the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump in Washington, U.S., January 21, 2020. REUTERS/Sarah Silbiger.\" height=\"3000\" width=\"6000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Earnings season kicked off on Tuesday, and executives are sounding off on the stimulus stalemate and the risks it poses to the ongoing economic recovery.</strong></li><li><strong>Hopes for a pre-election deal faded on Thursday after Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he'll <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-stimulus-package-coronavirus-relief-compromise-white-house-democrats-2020-10\">only bring a smaller measure to a vote</a>. The statement effectively dooms the larger proposal penned by the White House and Democrats.</strong></li><li><strong>Here's what five executives had to say about the lack of near-term aid and the challenges it presents.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>With earnings season officially underway, executives are weighing in on the stimulus stalemate that's gripped the US economy for months.</p><p>The chance of a pre-election relief deal faded through the week as Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell doubled down on his opposition to a major bill. The senator indicated Thursday that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-stimulus-package-coronavirus-relief-compromise-white-house-democrats-2020-10\">he plans to bring only a smaller measure to a vote</a>, dashing hopes for the $1.8 trillion to $2.2 trillion package currently being negotiated by Democrats and the White House.</p><p>Several indicators suggest the pace of economic recovery slowed into the fall as previous support programs dried up.&#160;Here's what five executives had to say about the lack of new stimulus and the challenges it presents.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-3-nonsensical-narratives-dangerous-heights-peter-cecchini-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">An ex-Wall Street chief strategist lambasts 3 'nonsensical narratives' he says are pushing stocks to dangerous heights — and warns that the current rally is unsustainable</a></em></p><h2>JPMorgan: 'We'll probably see delinquencies tick up'</h2><p>The March CARES Act played a major role in keeping Americans from defaulting on their debt, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/jpm-stock\">JPMorgan</a> Chief Financial Officer Jennifer Piepszak said in a Tuesday earnings call. The \"extraordinary support\" played a major role in the initial economic bounce-back through the spring, but the bank is already preparing for a dire start to the new year.</p><p>\"We'll probably see delinquencies tick up in the early part of 2021. We're not assuming further stimulus beyond the end of this year and how we think about reserves,\" Piepszak said, according to a transcript provided by Sentieo.</p><p>She continued: \"I think future stimulus would give us more confidence in the economy delivering on the base case.\"</p><h2>Bank of America: 'Stimulus coming in would move us further'</h2><p>A new relief bill would help struggling businesses and unemployed Americans, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/bac-stock\">Bank of America</a> CEO Brian Moynihan highlighted in a Wednesday call. Aid for state and local governments would also help prevent layoffs of government employees, he added.</p><p>Most major banks decreased their loan loss reserves through the third quarter as the economy rebounded. Still, Bank of America allocated $1.4 billion for potential credit losses.&#160;</p><p>\"Stimulus coming in would move us further\" toward lowering the loss provision, Moynihan said.</p><p>\"You'd see the reserves come out further because the lifetime expected loss would be lower. That's kind of the way it works.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-small-companies-recommendations-high-upside-rbc-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Buy these 7 unheralded stocks right now for near-term upside of at least 25% as growth accelerates to a new level, RBC says</a></em></p><h2>PNC: 'We're going to see an acceleration' in charge-offs</h2><p>As Congress nears its deadline to pass another relief measure, firms are bracing for more loans to sour. Such charge-offs will likely begin in pandemic-sensitive industries earlier in the year and trickle down to consumer debt in the second half of 2021, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pnc-stock\">PNC</a> CEO William Demchak said Wednesday.</p><p>\"The consumer number in my view is going to be highly dependent on whether they provide more fiscal stimulus, which I think they absolutely need to do,\" Demchak added. \"With PPP effectively running out and with the CARES Act having run out, we're going to see an acceleration [in charge-offs.]\"</p><p>The CEO cited a survey of small businesses as further evidence that new stimulus is needed. Roughly 60% of respondents expect to be out of business should the legislative deadlock last another year, Demchak said.</p><h2>Wells Fargo: 'Future credit performance may deteriorate'</h2><p>The US's unprecedented fiscal and monetary response to the pandemic helped the economy improve significantly, but slowed reopenings and the expiration of some stimulus programs \"are presenting headwinds,\" <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/wfc-stock\">Wells Fargo</a> CEO Charles Scharf said Wednesday.&#160;</p><p>For one, \"future credit performance may deteriorate\" as Americans receive less help from relief payments and expanded unemployment benefits, the CEO said. A recent study from Federal Reserve researchers found Americans used the majority of their stimulus checks <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-stimulus-checks-savings-pay-debts-federal-reserve-cares-act-2020-10\">on paying down debts and bolstering savings</a>.</p><p>In separate comments made during a Friday virtual panel, Scharf warned the nation is \"not out of the woods\" despite enjoying a steady climb from virus-induced lows.</p><p>\"The consumer has been extraordinarily strong through this crisis, and it's not luck, and it's not because they weren't affected. It's because of the CARES Act, specifically the unemployment assistance,\" Scharf said, adding the bank is seeing signs of Americans' cash balances \"starting to go away.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-expert-sees-us-transitioning-to-insolvency-phase-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">'I'm extremely concerned': A former Goldman Sachs hedge-fund chief says a flood of troubling signals shows the stock market is teetering — and warns a small correction could soon morph into something much larger</a></em></p><h2>United Airlines: 'We will continue ... to urge them to act'</h2><p>The airline industry in particular hinges on the prospect of more aid. Carriers began laying off tens of thousands of workers earlier this month to cut costs and weather the slowdown in travel activity.</p><p>House Democrats' $2.2 trillion proposal would allocate $25 billion to airline relief, the same amount set aside in the CARES Act. While Senate Republicans have balked at the measure, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has opposed a standalone bill for airlines without a larger stimulus bill.</p><p>As Congress continues to deliberate on fresh aid, United Airlines is pushing for an extension to the Payroll Support Program established in the CARES Act.</p><p>An extension \"would allow us to bring back US team members we had to furlough upon expiration of the CARES Act support on September 30,\"&#160;Brett Hart, chief administrative officer at <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/ual-stock\">United Airlines</a>, said Thursday. \"We will continue to engage leaders in both parties in Congress and in the administration to urge them to act.\"</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-strategy-4-stocks-to-buy-market-leaders-nancy-zevenbergen-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nancy Zevenbergen is in the top 1% of investors over the past 5 years. She breaks down what she looks for in young companies — and shares 4 stocks she thinks could be market leaders 10 years from now.</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/mortgage-rate-fall-record-low-housing-market-boom-sales-cause-2020-10-1029685635\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Mortgage rates hit 10th record low of 2020, further fueling the US housing market's boom</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/economic-outlook-coronavirus-risks-global-financial-crisis-debt-world-bank-2020-10-1029688877\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Coronavirus fallout can morph into a global financial crisis, the World Bank's chief economist says</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"The design of the new Portland International Airport main terminal has been unveiled — see what $1.5 billion project will look like","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/design-of-new-portland-international-airport-main-terminal-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89a9fbd260780019341cd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland International Airport PDX main terminal rendering\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The new Portland International Airport main terminal design rendering.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\" target=\"_blank\">Port of Portland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Port of Portland has unveiled the design plans for the new main terminal in the Portland International Airport.</li>\n<li>The design &#8212; created by architectural firm ZGF &#8212; includes aspects of nature throughout the interior.</li>\n<li>When the project is complete, the airport will be another 175,000 square feet larger but will use half of the energy per square foot compared to now.</li>\n<li>The main terminal project is expected to be completed in the spring of 2025 and will come with a $1.5 billion price tag.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Oregon's Port of Portland has unveiled the design plans for Portland International Airport's new main terminal, which is estimated to cost $1.5 billion.</p><p>The main terminal project was designed by <a href=\"https://www.zgf.com/about/\">ZGF, an American architectural firm </a>with offices on both coasts, including a location in Portland.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\">According to a news release from the Port of Portland</a>, the new design has a focus on \"health, wellbeing, and safety\", which is in part done by including aspects of nature into the earthquake-proofed terminal. This emphasis on nature can be seen throughout several aspects of the planned terminal, from its wooden roofing to the inclusion of plants.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe new main terminal will live inside of a spacious structure that has room for the airport to grow according to new tech additions and a predicted increase in travelers in the coming years, according to the Port of Portland.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89a7bc9e9fe40019009b7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland International Airport PDX main terminal rendering\" height=\"1886\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The new Portland International Airport main terminal design rendering.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\" target=\"_blank\">Port of Portland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The wood that will be used for the roof will be locally and sustainably sourced to bring more of the outside into the plant-lined terminal, according to the Port of Portland.&#160;</p><p>\"The roof design was inspired by the forests of the Pacific Northwest and the feeling you get while walking through the woods, the experience of light filtering through the trees, and the protection of the tree canopy,\"&#160; ZGF partner and lead interior designer for the PDX project Sharron van der Meulen <a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\">said in a statement</a>.</p><p>The roof installation is set to be in place in 2022.</p>\n\tThe designers included space for groups of stores and cafes to make the airport feel more like a street and sidewalk-lined Portland neighborhood.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89aa6ad260780019341cd4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland International Airport PDX main terminal rendering\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The new Portland International Airport main terminal design rendering.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\" target=\"_blank\">Port of Portland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>There will also be room for more public art inside of the terminal.</p>\n\tThe renderings of the new main terminal were unveiled on October 13, the 80th anniversary of the airport.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89aaaa9e9fe40019009bae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland International Airport PDX main terminal rendering\" height=\"1071\" width=\"2142\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The new Portland International Airport main terminal design rendering.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\" target=\"_blank\">Port of Portland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This new terminal is a part of the larger five-part \"PDX Next\" project, which also includes an upcoming car rental center, and a rental car wash and refueling space that opened over two years ago, to name some other projects.</p>\n\tWhen the main terminal is complete, the Portland International Airport will be another 175,000 square feet larger but will use half of the energy per square foot compared to now.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89aabd9e9fe40019009baf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland International Airport PDX main terminal rendering\" height=\"1405\" width=\"1874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The new Portland International Airport main terminal design rendering.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.portofportland.com/Newsroom/PDX-Turns-80-Shares-Early-Look-at-New-Airport-Design\" target=\"_blank\">Port of Portland</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The Port of Portland also has a goal of including small businesses in the construction process, and the entire project is expected to be completed during the spring of 2025.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"This $17,000 German-made kit gives the Tesla Model 3 a muscular makeover. Take a look at how it upgrades the most popular EV in America.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/german-body-kit-brabus-startech-new-tesla-model-3-redesign-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c83c9e9fe40019009a96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1520\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Startech, a German car-customization firm, dropped an array of upgrades for the Tesla Model 3.&#160;</li>\n<li>The modifications available include aggressive bumpers, new wheels, a spoiler, carbon-fiber accents, and revamped interior finishes.&#160;</li>\n<li>The whole set of customizations costs roughly $17,000 with labor included, and will be available to customers early next year, a company spokesperson told Business Insider.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The Tesla Model 3 is far and away the best-selling electric car in the country, making up <a href=\"https://afdc.energy.gov/data/10567\">nearly half</a> of all US EV sales in 2019. That popularity has given rise to a massive market for Model 3 body kits and accessories targeted at owners looking to set their car apart from the pack.&#160;</p><p>Now <a href=\"https://www.startech.de/en/startech-fahrzeuge/tesla-model-3/\">Startech</a>, a sub-brand of famed Mercedes-Benz tuner Brabus, is getting into the Tesla-makeover game as well, announcing a whole suite of customizations for the Model 3 that give the EV a sportier look and, according to the firm, enhance its performance.</p><p>The German firm unveiled add-ons including new wheels, faux-carbon accents, aggressive front and rear bumpers, lowering springs, and aerodynamic upgrades. It'll also reupholster your Model 3's interior and paint over any chrome pieces you deem too shiny.&#160;</p><p>The entire package will be available starting in early 2021 through Startech's worldwide dealer network and online, a spokesperson told Business Insider. Take a closer look below.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tStartech's full package includes loads of new parts meant to upgrade the Model 3's looks and performance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d9a89e9fe40019009d14?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"797\" width=\"1595\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe sharp-edged front bumper gives off major Lamborghini vibes, even if Startech says it's inspired by Formula 1 race cars.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c842d260780019341bcb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt costs roughly $1,300 — without installation, shipping, or paint — and Startech says it ups the Model 3's aerodynamics.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89da849e9fe40019009d18?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1214\" width=\"1619\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe same goes for Startech's rear bumper, which bolts onto the production bumper's mounting points and sports an integrated diffuser.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89defcd260780019341e6b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"startech tesla rear\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA rear wing — which also adds to the car's \"aerodynamic balance\" — will run you around $450, again without paint, labor, or delivery.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c841d260780019341bc6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1564\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe three-part spoiler extends onto the sides of the car, giving it a unique look.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c83dd260780019341bc1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's complemented by side skirts that attach in front of the rear wheels.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c842d260780019341bca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1669\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tStartech designed 20-inch alloy wheels specifically for the Model 3. The hub cover comes in black, silver, red, and blue.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c842d260780019341bcc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNew suspension springs from Startech lower the Model 3 by 30-40 millimeters, giving it a more imposing look and lowering its center of gravity.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c83fd260780019341bc2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1575\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tCustomers can also choose a \"chrome delete\" option whereby Startech paints or otherwise refinishes the Model 3's shinier bits like the window trim, camera housings, or door handles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c83c9e9fe40019009a98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tStartech's modifications don't stop with the exterior, though. The firm offers the option to refinish interior pieces in a faux-carbon-fiber trim.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c839d260780019341bc0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThat's available for the steering wheel and the trim around the window switches.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c841d260780019341bc7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAt its upholstery shop, Startech can redo the Model 3's interior in any color of Alcantara or leather.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c83a9e9fe40019009a95?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe model pictured here has an \"anthracite\" headliner made from Alcantara ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89e7c3d260780019341ea1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... along with new floor mats.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89e807d260780019341ea3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech floor mats\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIncluding fitting and painting costs, the full conversion shown here costs roughly $17,000 at current exchange rates.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c842d260780019341bc9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1573\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Startech Tesla Model 3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Startech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tStartech is planning to release modifications for the Model Y next, a spokesperson said.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c841d260780019341bc8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Startech Tesla Model 3\" height=\"1668\" publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520910},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"A hiring manager for Google and Amazon says she's wary of candidates who can't admit they're wrong — here's what she looks for instead","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/hiring-manager-google-amazon-says-shes-always-wary-of-candidates-with-one-red-flag-personality-trait-2019-4","description":"<p dir=\"ltr\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc20388b14bf46265272231?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon\" height=\"2048\" width=\"2731\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amazon gets its pick of top talent, but not everyone makes the cut.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP/Mark Lennihan</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li dir=\"ltr\">Nancy Wang has been a hiring manager at both Google and Amazon, two companies that get their pick of the best and brightest candidates in tech.</li>\n<li dir=\"ltr\">She says the most desirable candidates &#8212; and the ones who ultimately make the cut &#8212; are naturally curious people who like solving problems and can learn as they go.</li>\n<li dir=\"ltr\">Wang has also figured out how to quickly identify candidates who probably won't work out: They're know-it-alls who can't admit when they're wrong and what they don't know.</li>\n<li dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></li>\n</ul><p dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"https://www.inc.com/bill-saporito/amazon-3-billion-deal-pay-off-investment-startups.html\">Amazon</a>&#160;and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.inc.com/betsy-mikel/google-looked-for-1-personality-trait-when-hiring-its-early-employees.html\">Google</a>&#160;get their pick of top talent. The world's most profitable tech companies offer&#160;<a href=\"https://www.inc.com/betsy-mikel/googles-former-head-of-hr-says-this-is-why-many-top-performers-quit.html\">competitive compensation packages</a>&#160;and attract the industry's best and brightest candidates.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">So who ultimately makes the cut?</p><p dir=\"ltr\">Ask that question to Nancy Wang, who's been a hiring manager for both companies. She used to be a product manager for Google Fiber. Currently, she's a senior manager for Amazon Web Services. Wang is also the founder and CEO of Advancing Women in Product, a non-profit organization that aims to empower more women and under-represented groups to become tech leaders.</p><h2 dir=\"ltr\">What makes successful candidates stand out from so-so ones</h2><p dir=\"ltr\">\"The most successful candidates I've seen are naturally curious,\" she wrote on&#160;<a href=\"https://www.quora.com/session/Nancy-Wang-28/1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Quora</a>. \"What is most important is their ability to pick things up quick and their 'can do' attitude.\" Just like&#160;<a href=\"https://www.inc.com/betsy-mikel/to-hire-all-star-employees-steve-jobs-looked-for-1-non-negotiable-quality.html\">Steve Jobs</a>, Wang looks for problem solvers and who can learn as they go.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">Wang says expertise is only one part of the hiring puzzle. It's not related to how smart a candidate is, what degrees she has, or which top-tier university he did or didn't go to. Wang believes there's only so much knowledge one person can have. And in an interview, it's not fair to assume the candidate is an expert on everything. Being able to dive in and let your curiosity lead you to finding answers will help a new hire be successful at any job.</p><h2 dir=\"ltr\">Candidates with one red-flag trait are less likely to get hired</h2><p dir=\"ltr\">In her experience hiring for Amazon and Google, Wang has figured out how to quickly identify candidates who probably won't work out. Know-it-alls tend not to do well at either company.<iframe width=\"1\" height=\"1\" frameborder=\"0\" data-google-container-id=\"2\" data-load-complete=\"true\"></iframe></p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"What worries me during interviews is when candidates purport to know something and then when I dig deeper, the whole house of cards start falling apart,\" Wang writes.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">No matter what their level, employees need to be leaders. And leaders need to be able to be comfortable asking questions if they don't know something. They also need to admit when they're wrong.</p><h2 dir=\"ltr\">The strategic interview question that weeds out the know-it-alls</h2><p dir=\"ltr\">The personality trait that worries Wang in&#160;interviews is one that&#160;<a href=\"https://www.inc.com/betsy-mikel/heres-how-to-spot-an-egocentric-jerk-in-first-15-minutes-of-an-interview.html\">Boxed CEO Chieh Huang&#160;</a>also avoids. He wants to hire people who are comfortable being honest about what they don't know. Those people tend to be better collaborators and more pleasant to work with.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">Huang even has an interview question that gets to the heart of overconfidence: He asks people to rate their knowledge of technology trends on a scale of 1 to 10. He doesn't believe anyone who answers with a 9 or a 10, because no one can know everything.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"The reality is, the whole industry is shifting and no one knows what's going to happen in the next 10 years — no one,\" explains Huang. &#160;<br><br></p><p dir=\"ltr\"><em>This article was originally republished by Business Insider in April 2019.</em></p><div 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Beijing has threatened to arrest Americans in China if the US doesn't stop persecuting Chinese scholars","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/report-china-threatens-detain-american-citizens-over-persecution-chinese-scholars-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c1f8bc21cfb0019468a5e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Xi\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kyodo News Stills via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Beijing has reportedly threatened to arrest Americans in China amid growing tensions between the countries.</li>\n<li>Beijing says the US is unfairly detaining Chinese academics and has threatened to retaliate on numerous occasions, according to a report.</li>\n<li>Earlier this year, the US Department of Justice arrested four Chinese researchers who it accused of hiding affiliations with the People's Liberation Army in their visa applications.</li>\n<li>The US State Department is advising Americans to avoid travel to China after Beijing indicted two Canadian nationals for espionage.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Beijing has repeatedly threatened to lock up Americans in China if the US does not drop its Chinese scholars' persecution.</p><p>China has communicated the threat to the White House on numerous occasions and through multiple channels, including the US embassy in Beijing, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-warns-u-s-it-may-detain-americans-in-response-to-prosecutions-of-chinese-scholars-11602960959\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">according to The Wall Street Journal.</a></p><p>This latest escalation in tension between the White House and Beijing dates back to July when the US Department of Justice arrested four Chinese researchers, accused of concealing affiliations with the People's Liberation Army in their visa applications. One — Juan Tang — spent a month in the Chinese consulate in California before being arrested by the FBI. She denied the allegations and has since been released on bail.</p><p>At the time of her arrest, Beijing warned the US that it would detain an American in China if Tang were not allowed to return to China, the Wall Street Journal reported.</p><p>Since then, the US has stepped up its campaign to identify Chinese academics and students it claims security risks. Last month it revoked visas for 1,000 Chinese nationals who wanted to study and research in the US.</p><p>As part of an increasingly hardline approach to Beijing, the Trump administration has accused China of seeking to steal technology and military information in a bid to overtake replace it as the world's leading superpower.</p><p>Last month, the US State Department advised citizens against traveling to China, warning that Beijing was using arbitrary detention and blocking foreign nationals from leaving \"to gain bargaining leverage over foreign governments.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/two-canadians-detained-in-china-indicted-on-espionage-charges-11592545373\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">In June</a>, Beijing indicted two Canadian nationals on espionage charges 18 months after first detaining the pair.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/report-china-threatens-detain-american-citizens-over-persecution-chinese-scholars-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/tYnrdm5yJKE\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 14:07:07 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8c1fa9c21cfb0019468a5f?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0b57bce9cf8f46608cc7ce49e8758026","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn64@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-37-137_7423bca28bfab14b.webp","destWidth":763,"destHeight":572,"sourceBytes":28680,"destBytes":28680,"author":"apayne@businessinsider.com (Adam Payne)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8c1f8bc21cfb0019468a5e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-25-593_7e9ddf9fb59cff96.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn48@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-22-654_cd8d2f3432af77b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn71@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-34-728_cecc133c6b53e549.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tYnrdm5yJKE:HkQO9Au_NPY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn36@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-25-433_cbfa7a77be6918db.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/tYnrdm5yJKE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn43@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-35-303_5f47966b42fa9a95.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520933},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Breast Cancer Awareness month has been tainted by corporations and should be abolished","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/abolish-breast-cancer-awareness-month-corporate-money-healthcare-pink-ribbon-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f889b2ed260780019341a92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 130945669\" height=\"998\" width=\"1995\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Breast Cancer Awareness Month (BCAM) sanitizes a deadly disease and exploits it for corporate gain.</li>\n<li>Despite billions of dollars spent, 'pinkwashing' has brought us no closer to a cure, and has trivialized the problems at the heart of the epidemic.</li>\n<li>BCAM emphasizes personal, rather than societal failings through \"survivor\" narratives. But because of the structural and environmental causes, curing the disease should be considered a social justice issue.</li>\n<li>Isobel van Hagen is a freelance writer and journalist from New York currently living in London.</li>\n<li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Every October, the multi-billion-dollar \"Cancer Industry\" bombards us with pink ribbons on NFL fields, pink ribbon shoes, <a href=\"https://www.prwatch.org/spin/2009/11/8671/pinkwashing-turns-itself-breast-cancer-awareness-gun\">pink guns</a>, <a href=\"https://archive.thinkprogress.org/police-are-celebrating-breast-cancer-awareness-with-some-astonishingly-tone-deaf-results-d68b89a502d5/\">police cars</a>, wine bottles, and now, <a href=\"https://www.etsy.com/uk/listing/863494652/pink-ribbon-fabric-face-mask-pink-fabric?gpla=1&gao=1&&utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=shopping_uk_en_gb_d-bath_and_beauty-personal_care-face_masks_and_coverings&utm_custom1=3171ef5e-13a0-49fb-b7ca-84c427daa08f&utm_content=go_10630665732_104460692785_450901781701_pla-908906428531_c__863494652engb&utm_custom2=10630665732&gclid=CjwKCAjwiOv7BRBREiwAXHbv3Dj-ZC_n0M9_VZl7wmzNkbWKJ5t1bPForZLeBqqlVMmFQgK5AV8jORoCKQ4QAvD_BwEorZLeBqqlVMmFQgK5AV8jORoCKQ4QAvD_BwE\">face masks</a> — all in the name of breast cancer \"awareness\".&#160;</p><p>Like any good brand-activism marketing campaign, National Breast Cancer Awareness Month (NBCAM) is about corporate profit and customers' desire for ethical consumption. <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2018/10/17/17989624/pinkwashing-breast-cancer-awareness-products-profit\">'Pinkwashing'</a> allows companies to advertise their brands as woman-positive, and do little else.</p><p>This branding is not only unhelpful, but is actively harmful to its cause. This October, it is time to bring some awareness to the awareness industry.&#160;</p><h2>The corporate beginnings of Breast Cancer Awareness Month</h2><p>It comes as no surprise that National Breast Cancer Awareness Month was originated by a multinational pharmaceutical company.</p><p>In the 1980s, Zeneca Inc. (now AstraZeneca) partnered with the American Cancer Society as they began the awareness campaign in conjunction with a breast cancer screening program at the company.</p><p>The costs to the drug company of running the early detection program <a href=\"https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/0033563032000160981\">were estimated to be</a> $400,000. The total costs to the company if they chose <em>not</em> to run the program were estimated to be around $1.5 million. It was simple math.</p><p>While AstraZeneca has since added that \"the health of women is also a motivating factor,\" BCAM was conceived by a company that not only profits from the epidemic, but<a href=\"https://bcaction.org/our-take-on-breast-cancer/patients-before-profits/\"> may be contributing to its cause</a>. The recognizable symbol and money-maker of breast cancer – the pink ribbon – was attached to it shortly after.</p><p>Born from a desire for profit, the current state of Breast Cancer Awareness Month continues in this tradition.&#160;</p><h2>Most corporations participating in BCAM don't even donate to the cause</h2><p><a href=\"https://bcaction.org/the-cancer-industry/\">On its website</a>, the activist group Breast Cancer Action writes: \"The cancer industry consists of corporations, organizations, and agencies that diminish or mask the extent of the cancer problem, fail to protect our health, or divert attention away from the importance of finding the causes of breast cancer and working to prevent the disease.\"</p><p>The money trail of funds allocated to cancer research is nearly impossible to track, because any company can put a pink ribbon on its products with no oversight.</p><p>Even so, organizations like Susan G. Komen or Avon Cosmetics, say they have <a href=\"https://ww5.komen.org/\">invested millions, or even billions</a>, of dollars into breast cancer research. But <a href=\"http://breastcancerconsortium.net/resources/topics/research-dollars/\">where does the money actually go</a>? <br><br>Because there are <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2018/10/17/17989624/pinkwashing-breast-cancer-awareness-products-profit\">no federally mandated rules</a> for marketing campaigns, Gayle Sulik, author of \"Pink Ribbon Blues: How Breast Cancer Culture Undermines Women's Health\" told Vox News that, \"it is up to only consumers to hold companies accountable.\"</p><p>Reebok, in <a href=\"https://thinkbeforeyoupink.org/resources/before-you-buy/\">one of many examples</a>, marketed a line of pink ribbon footwear. Though it promoted the fact that some of their pink ribbon product sales would be donated to the Avon Breast Cancer Crusade, they set a limit of $750,000 — regardless of how many shoes were sold.&#160;</p><p>More duplicitous are the companies who participate in October activities, while actively producing cancer-causing chemicals and carcinogens, like <a href=\"https://www.warriorsinpink.ford.com/\">car companies that cause pollution</a> or <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/oct/17/why-are-makeup-companies-able-to-give-breast-cancer-patients-toxic-products\">toxins in cosmetics</a>.</p><p>In terms of NGOs, it has been <a href=\"https://www.marieclaire.com/politics/news/a6506/breast-cancer-business-scams/\">well-documented</a> that millions in donor funds have been spent on 'awareness' events and salaries, instead of research.</p><h2>BCAM capitalizes on breast cancer without actually helping&#160;</h2><p>You may say: \"So what?\" Beyond inevitable corporate greed, isn't this better than nothing? Some money is going somewhere useful, it's bringing attention to a deadly disease, and — at the very least — it provides people with a sense of community.</p><p>This process is a usual product of capitalism, similar to the recent corporate <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/corporations-companies-black-lives-matter-invest-police-racism-inequality-2020-7\">co-optation of the Black Lives Matter</a> movement or the <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2018/6/25/17476850/pride-month-lgbtq-corporate-explained\">usage of the pride flag</a> to sell merchandise. It is cyclical and works to uphold the status quo because it doesn't delve any deeper than \"awareness\" — which is essentially devoid of any real meaning - all in the name of profit.</p><p>The prevalence of corporate \"pinkwashing\" also contributes to the sexualization and gendering of the disease: with slogans like <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/and-while-im-at-it-who-ev_b_8258164\">\"Save the ta-tas</a>\" and \"Squeeze a boob, save a life\", which inherently trivializes the harrowing bodily violence endured by cancer patients.</p><p>In actuality, the normalization of observing breast cancer through pink-tinted glasses not only allows for the commodification of and profiting off a disease, it ensures distraction from the actual problem at hand: that the breast cancer epidemic is a social justice issue.</p><p>BCAM campaigns brush over the fact that the price of cancer treatments, for example, is <a href=\"https://www.cancer.org/latest-news/study-shows-us-cancer-drug-costs-increasing-despite-competition.html\">increasing at a faster rate in the US</a> compared to any other country (disproportionately affecting low-income patients). Or that the Affordable Care Act, which covers millions of people with preexisting conditions — including breast cancer — is in jeopardy.</p><p>There are also pervasive racial disparities related to lack of quality care, which awareness campaigns conveniently ignore. While Black women are less likely to develop breast cancer, they are 40% more likely to die from it than white women, <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/cancer/dcpc/research/articles/breast_cancer_rates_women.htm\">according to</a> the CDC.</p><h2>The heart of the issue isn't early detection</h2><p>But what about \"early detection\" as a form of healthcare? (The favorite motto of the Breast Cancer Awareness Month–believers).</p><p>The importance of the mammogram <a href=\"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4462532/\">has been hotly debated</a> — and while early detection is useful, it can lead to chronic <a href=\"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24451829/\">over-treatment</a> coupled with <a href=\"https://pinkribbonblues.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Ehrenreich-2001-WelcomeToCancerland-Harpers.pdf\">unnecessary biopsies and stress</a>. Early detection also does not mean a patient will have a better chance of living, or being cured.</p><p>And despite the October stress on mammograms and billions of 'awareness' dollars raised for the cause, <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/cancer/breast/statistics/index.htm\">death rates in the US remain</a> where they were 20 years ago.</p><p>In 1998, breast cancer activist Barbara Brenner <a href=\"https://bcaction.org/2020/05/06/annual-tour-argues-toxins-create-cancers/\">spoke to a crowd in California</a> explaining that the central message of National Breast Cancer Awareness Month — that annual mammograms save lives — is misleading.&#160;</p><p>\"Mammograms and better drugs won't stop cancer rates from rising, but stopping these companies from dumping millions of tons of cancer-causing chemicals into the air and water might.\"</p><p>BCAM ignores and distracts from the structural health and environmental inequalities behind the illness, like <a href=\"https://bcaction.org/our-take-on-breast-cancer/environment/\">toxic chemicals, a lack of chemical regulation policies</a>, and exposure to carcinogens, by putting the onus on the individual: <em>you</em> must get a mammogram, <em>you</em> must buy this pink ribbon to help, <em>you</em> are a fighter, <em>you</em> are a survivor.&#160; Barbara Ehrenreich <a href=\"https://pinkribbonblues.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Ehrenreich-2001-WelcomeToCancerland-Harpers.pdf\">calls this the</a> \"the triumphalism of survivorhood\" that \"denigrates the dead and the dying, a sense in which breast cancer survivors are understood to have somehow fought harder than those who have died.\"</p><p>A practical step before buying those pink shoes this month is to do some research into if and where companies are donating: Is there a cap on their donations? What percentage of their sales goes to a cause that examines underlying social factors? Are they being transparent?</p><p>It seems, at its worst, breast cancer awareness is a marketing tool that works to sanitize suffering. My mother, like thousands of breast cancer patients before and after her, did everything \"right\". She detected early, she went through countless rounds of chemotherapy, radiation, endless nauseating drugs, and a mastectomy. And despite all of the \"awareness\", her cancer still brutally metastasized.</p><p>Obituaries often read, \"She died after a tough battle with breast cancer\" rather than, \"the cost of her healthcare and the lack of research into the structural causes of breast cancer gave her no chance.\"</p><p>When Brenner died, her partner <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/21/us/barbara-brenner-breast-cancer-iconoclast-dies-at-61.html\">said in her obituary</a>:</p><p>\"She died after a long battle with the breast cancer industry.\"</p><p><em>Isobel van Hagen is a freelance writer and journalist from New York currently living in London. She writes primarily about gender issues, religious movements, healthcare access and the arts. Previously, she attended McGill University and Columbia Journalism School and has worked for various publications including Newsday, Newsweek, The Independent and NBC News. </em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/abolish-breast-cancer-awareness-month-corporate-money-healthcare-pink-ribbon-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=RGBohcfvz8I:0H52EjhBoas:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img
