height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 14:03:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f889b219e9fe40019009967?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"b84dc37dd8b54e1d890d836e8cb44c8b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn64@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-16-923_999df00ed87488e2.webp","destWidth":1995,"destHeight":1496,"sourceBytes":137026,"destBytes":137026,"author":"insider@insider.com (Isobel van Hagen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f889b2ed260780019341a92?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn75@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-30-474_046a562cea5736b7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=RGBohcfvz8I:0H52EjhBoas:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-22-978_7292a73c070767a4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=RGBohcfvz8I:0H52EjhBoas:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn47@2020_1/2020/10/18/17-02-18-120_4cdca01922401d2a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=RGBohcfvz8I:0H52EjhBoas:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn48@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-23-698_5c0c30aca0b1bf72.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/RGBohcfvz8I":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn32@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-26-350_9232d601170a26c3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520908},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"I visited the new American Express Centurion Lounge at JFK airport and saw why a $550 annual cardholder fee is worth it – see inside","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-the-amex-centurion-lounge-at-jfk-airport-photos-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f848d07c255d800190b952d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"American Express Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The American Express Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport opened to guests on Friday.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>American Express just opened the first Centurion Lounge at New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport.&#160;</li>\n<li>The 12th Centurion Lounge in the US offers JFK passengers complimentary hot food and alcoholic beverages before departure, in addition to wellness offerings and the first airport speakeasy bar.</li>\n<li>Amex Platinum and Centurion cardholders, as well as Delta Air Lines Amex Reserve cardholders, can access the lounge up to three hours before their flight.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>American Express celebrated the opening of its newest Centurion Lounge at New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport on Friday, the latest in a nationwide expansion that's brought its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/amex-centurion-lounges-how-to-access\">total number of lounges to 12 in the US with two at New York City airports alone</a>.&#160;</p><p>Located in Terminal 4, flyers on Delta Air Lines and other international carriers utilizing the terminal can enjoy over 15,000 square feet of plush seating, complimentary hot meals, unlimited alcoholic beverages, and a reprieve from the crowds in the main terminal.&#160;</p><p>Centurion Lounges are among the greatest-selling features of American Express' most expensive credit cards. Geared toward frequent travelers, cardholders pay a high annual fee typically greater than $500 and receive perks such as access to the Centurion Lounge, travel credits, and travel insurance, among other benefits that help offset the yearly cost.&#160;</p><p>Access is restricted to American Express' top cardholders, including those with Platinum or Centurion cards, instead of passengers flying on a specific airline. Delta Air Lines Reserve cardholders can also access the lounge and in turn, American Express Platinum cardholders can use Delta SkyClub's when flying the airline.&#160;&#160;</p><p>New COVID-19-related safety protocols have been implemented across the lounge including capacity restrictions, plexiglass dividers, and reduced self-service capabilities. Entry is also limited to 3 hours before departure, though connecting passengers are exempt from that rule.&#160;</p><p>Take a look inside the newest Centurion Lounge.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tAmerican Express launched construction on this Centurion Lounge in 2018 with a projected opening in 2019 but after around a year of delays, it finally opened on October 9.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812180642e9400180b5263?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1613\" width=\"2151\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/amex-centurion-lounge-jfk-2018-1\">Business Insider</a></p>\n\tThe famous blue doors welcome passengers to the newest addition to Terminal 4 at JFK International Airport.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f84a00191aa9e001880b0c5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"American Express Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlyers visiting a Centurion Lounge during the pandemic will immediately notice new safety features including plexiglass partitions and social distancing floor placards at check-in.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2534c3b2e0019bba470?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA new push towards touchless is allowing guests to check into the lounge via their phones, reducing interactions with Amex staff.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812196642e9400180b5264?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis premium lounge is one of 12 in Terminal 4 and building it required an extension of the terminal itself.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121a4bab422001979a951?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe angled floor-to-ceiling windows mark the terminal building's former perimeter with most of the lounge requiring a newly constructed appendage.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121bc642e9400180b5265?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1660\" width=\"2214\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWeekday mornings would normally see this lounge packed from wall to wall but during the time of our visit on its opening day, less than 10 passengers filled the two-level lounge.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121acbab422001979a952?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNew COVID-19 safety features in the lounge include blocked seats to ensure social distancing throughout.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121c7642e9400180b5266?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd larger spaces and tables, including the multi-purpose room that's typically reserved for families – are available on-request and reserved for groups of three or more.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121e1642e9400180b5267?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBuilding a majority of the lounge from scratch allowed for unique spaces, including these treehouse-style hideaways.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c250ea74820019ca6590?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThey're found throughout the lounge and are typically one to two-person spaces ideal for getting work done in private or taking a phone call.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24cea74820019ca6585?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEach is also themed with a specific year that could be important to American Express or New York City.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812231bab422001979a958?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis one is themed 2016, for example, the year in which the Oculus opened next to the World Trade Center and across the street from Amex's downtown Manhattan headquarters. The iconic building can just about be made out along the back wall.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c247ea74820019ca6575?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe 223-seat top level is the main floor where the bulk of the amenities are offered. Various seating types line the space along the floor-to-ceiling windows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121fb642e9400180b5269?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeats include leather couches, standalone chairs, and private cubicles to accommodate a variety of travelers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812208642e9400180b526a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1595\" width=\"2127\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor solo travelers, these seats offer additional privacy in the form of high walls, a reminder that social distancing was popular in lounges even before the pandemic.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812210bab422001979a956?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe lounge's location at the edge of Terminal 4 also provides visitors with unobstructed views of the tarmac below.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8121f5bab422001979a955?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBusiness travelers can avail themselves of the complimentary printer services...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812218bab422001979a957?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd a conference room area tucked away in a corner of the lounge away from the high traffic areas.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812220642e9400180b526b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's an ideal space for a pre-trip business meeting but can also be used by large families enjoying a meal together before their flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812228642e9400180b526c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe conference room table, like most seating areas in the lounge, is peppered with pop-up power outlets and USB charging ports.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f81223e642e9400180b526d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tMagazines and newspapers would normally be kept here but the lounge is going digital to reduce touchpoints for visitors.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812245bab422001979a959?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe opposite end of the top floor is home to the main dining area and one of the lounge's three bars.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f812273642e9400180b526e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis is where the Centurion Lounge sets itself apart from other lounges as visitors can enjoy hot meals that are not only complementary but crafted by renowned chefs including Ignacio Mattos.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24cea74820019ca6586?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNormally self-serve, lounge staff now serve patrons to avoid crowding in the area. First on the menu during our visit was soup, with two options including a farro soup and chicken broth with butternut squash crostini.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24eea74820019ca658c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe starter was then a fennel salad...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f846b6d642e9400180b5548?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1070\" width=\"1427\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFollowed by the main course of steak and potatoes...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2504c3b2e0019bba46a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOr a fried maitake mushroom po' boy, a vegan dish...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24a4c3b2e0019bba457?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd chocolate cake with whipped cream to finish. A veritable feast.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f846be5bab422001979ac42?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1107\" width=\"1476\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnother feature of the buffet is the avocado toast station, a growing trend in airport lounges. Toppings include mozzarella balls, tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2494c3b2e0019bba454?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHere's what the finished result looks like.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c251ea74820019ca6593?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEven during the pandemic, the commitment to quality was evident. Not only was the steak dish perfectly plated on a mini cast iron pan but the meat was cooked to perfection, with the potatoes covered in a savory cheese sauce that also didn't disappoint.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24bea74820019ca6582?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOne bite of the steak and I couldn't believe this was being served in an airport lounge and complimentary.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24aea74820019ca657b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOpposite the buffet is a small dining area, with half of the tables blocked off for social distancing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8122aa642e9400180b5270?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHungry diners would do well to grab a seat here as the menu will encourage multiple trips to the buffet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8122b0642e9400180b5271?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's also directly adjacent to the first of three full-service bars.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f81229dbab422001979a95c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPlexiglass partitions are featured at each bartender station but all the barstools have been blocked to prevent crowding in the area.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8122b7bab422001979a95d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlcoholic beverages are complimentary in the Centurion Lounge while airline lounges will often charge for cocktails and high-end beers, wines, and liquors.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c246ea74820019ca6573?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut while sitting at the bar is a no-go, for now, high-tops throughout the lounge offer better views of the tarmac.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c245ea74820019ca6571?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd unlike the bars, these tables – located on both levels – feature pop-up power outlets and USB charging ports.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24d4c3b2e0019bba460?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe lounge also features multiple full-service coffee machines with capabilities to make drinks like espresso, cappuccino, and hot chocolate.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c248ea74820019ca6577?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor water drinkers, a multi-use tap offers sparkling and still options.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24dea74820019ca6587?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd this is only the top floor, there's more to see downstairs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24eea74820019ca658b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe lower floor of the lounge is arranged in the same style as the top with the same variety of seating along the windows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24fea74820019ca658e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt was even more deserted than the main level but would typically house more visitors than upstairs thanks to greater availability of seats.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24eea74820019ca658a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere's also more seating away from the window on the lower level.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24c4c3b2e0019bba45f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut the great views do remain throughout.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24e4c3b2e0019bba465?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tInstead of a conference room in the corner, this floor has a colorful cubicle-style seating area, again ideal for solo flyers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24cea74820019ca6584?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe lower floor also features a smaller buffet station, though the selection is slightly limited than the one above.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2514c3b2e0019bba46c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe dining area is just slightly smaller than the one above with four tables instead of six.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f84918491aa9e001880b025?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd here's the second complimentary bar in the lounge, with a similar selection to the one located directly above.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f84917b91aa9e001880b024?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDirectly adjacent is a copper wall, which one might think is the lounge's end. But just beyond is actually one of the lounge's coolest features...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f849175c255d800190b9550?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA hidden speakeasy bar.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2544c3b2e0019bba472?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere's no secret passcode to enter and you don't have to be Eliot Ness to find it but the location isn't exactly advertised. Case in point, I walked right by the door without knowing the secret beyond it.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2514c3b2e0019bba46d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNamed \"1850,\" after the year of American Express' founding, the hideaway is the first speakeasy in an airport and offers a more unique drink offering from the bars above.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c254ea74820019ca6598?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhiskey, vodka, and gin drinks are the main focus of the cocktail list, curated list by award-winning mixologist Jim Meehan. Wines are selected by Anthony Giglio.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f849161c255d800190b954f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBack on the main floor is the Equinox Body Lab, a health and wellness experience that's also complimentary for passengers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f84915a91aa9e001880b023?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tInside is a large workout room with self-guided exercises for fitness-oriented travelers...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24f4c3b2e0019bba466?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tYoga room...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c248ea74820019ca6579?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd a relaxation room where flyers listen to meditation guides while resting on a vibrating lounge chair.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c245ea74820019ca656f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTo help get cleaned up after a visit to Equinox or a long day of traveling, the lounge also has shower rooms.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2534c3b2e0019bba471?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThey're closed now for safety reasons but in normal times, lounge patrons can make a reservation to use these showers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c2574c3b2e0019bba478?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAviation enthusiasts and New York City locals alike will also notice the themed artwork across the facility, hearkening back to the golden days of flying and New York in its heyday.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24aea74820019ca657d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe JFK lounge is just one of many that American Express plans to open or has opened in 2020 as the Centurion Lounge network continues to grow and the company gives frequent travelers even bigger reasons to become cardholders.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f80c24e4c3b2e0019bba463?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amex Centurion Lounge JFK Airport\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Amex Centurion Lounge at JFK Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Business Sachs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-impact-biden-capital-gains-tax-selling-pressure-gs-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ef23d260780019341ed6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages-joe biden\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Joe Biden's planned capital-gains tax may put immediate selling pressure on stocks, according to Goldman Sachs.</strong></li><li><strong>In a Friday note the firm explained that the last capital-gains tax hike in 2013 sparked a stock sell-off worth roughly $100 billion from wealthy individuals.</strong></li><li><strong>However, those individuals who sold quickly bought back stocks only a few months later, leading Goldman to conclude that the household selling around tax hikes will be \"short-lived and fully offset in the subsequent quarters.\" </strong></li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</strong></a><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Biden's planned capital-gains tax hike may put immediate selling pressure on stocks given what's happened in markets after previous rate increases, according to Goldman Sachs.</p><p>A team of Goldman analysts led by Arjun Menon wrote on Friday that Joe Biden's proposed changes to the corporate tax code would be complemented by an increase in the tax rate applied to capital gains and dividends for the highest income individuals.</p><p>History has shown that capital-gains tax hikes spark stock sell-offs. After the last capital-gains tax rate increase in 2013, the wealthiest 1% of households sold 1% of their starting equity and mutual fund assets, worth about $100 billion today, in the three months leading up to the rate hike, according to Goldman. As of 2020, the wealthiest 1% of Americans own 53% of all household stocks. Their collective actions can move markets.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-small-companies-recommendations-high-upside-rbc-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Buy these 7 unheralded stocks right now for near-term upside of at least 25% as growth accelerates to a new level, RBC says</a></em></p><p>While this selling may be a downside risk to stock allocations in 2020, Goldman said it will not result in a long-term sell-off or slowing economic growth.</p><p>In the months following the 2013 rate hike, the top 1% bought back more stocks than they had sold prior to the change, said Goldman. Their reduction in stock exposure was only temporary, and Goldman said it believes that same pattern is likely to occur again.&#160;</p><p>\"We expect household selling around capital-gains tax rate changes should be short-lived and fully offset in the subsequent quarters,\" Goldman wrote.</p><p>In fact, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-demand-wealthiest-americans-one-percent-household-goldman-buy-2020-10-1029688986#\">Goldman forecasted that the wealthiest 1% of Americans will be the largest drivers of total stock demand in 2021</a>, even with a \"blue wave\" election outcome.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-3-nonsensical-narratives-dangerous-heights-peter-cecchini-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">An ex-Wall Street chief strategist lambasts 3 'nonsensical narratives' he says are pushing stocks to dangerous heights — and warns that the current rally is unsustainable</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-impact-biden-capital-gains-tax-selling-pressure-gs-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VNKkPcYUnDg\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 13:20:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f623b5a57b7da001ee11fb3?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"b0f1e7719389a5e0d082e5595641572c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn28@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-36-740_f509246bef8d5415.webp","destWidth":910,"destHeight":682,"sourceBytes":23234,"destBytes":23234,"author":"egraffeo@businessinsider.com (Emily Graffeo)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89ef23d260780019341ed6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-16-853_825be5cf9e0a8a15.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VNKkPcYUnDg:QBqNTcR_Moc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn51@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-27-223_7523766dea914dac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VNKkPcYUnDg:QBqNTcR_Moc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-33-449_9ec6d682b9cbf4c3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VNKkPcYUnDg:QBqNTcR_Moc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn52@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-009_ad099d47edba06b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/VNKkPcYUnDg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn7@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-32-343_7c3a22ef8bb63a97.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520894},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Sweden is moving away from its no-lockdown strategy and preparing strict new rules amid rising coronavirus cases","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/sweden-shifts-away-no-lockdown-strategy-amid-growing-case-numbers-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4d40c21cfb0019468a6c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Stockholme\" height=\"750\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jonathan NACKSTRAND / AFP) (Photo by JONATHAN NACKSTRAND/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Sweden's health officials are set to unveil strict new coronavirus rules for local regions to impose.</li>\n<li>The country opted against lockdown measures in response to the first wave of the pandemic.</li>\n<li>However, growing case numbers in areas like the cities of Stockholm and Uppsala have prompted a rethink.</li>\n<li>Authorities in the worst-affected areas are set to have the power to strongly recommend people to avoid public transport, busy public places, and contact with the vulnerable and elderly.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Sweden will shift away from its early coronavirus strategy of opting against lockdown measures and instead embrace restrictive measures adopted by most of its neighbors amid growing case numbers in the country.</p><p>Anders Tegnell, Sweden's state epidemiologist, is set to meet with local health officials next week to discuss which measures to put into place in response to outbreaks in the capital Stockholm and nearby city Uppsala, <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/10/17/sweden-considers-local-lockdowns-shift-coronavirus-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Telegraph newspaper reported.</a></p><p>Unlike its Nordic neighbors and most other countries, Sweden did not deploy wholesale lockdown measures in response to the first wave of the coronavirus pandemic earlier this year.</p><p>Instead, the government led by Prime Minister Stefan Löfven allowed shops, bars, and restaurants to remain mostly open and students to attend school, to avoid a sharp second spike in cases later in 2020.</p><p>Sweden has recorded a much higher death per population rate than any of its neighbors since adopting this strategy. It had recorded 5,918 deaths as of Sunday, compared to 278 in Norway and 346 in Finland.</p><p>Umea University's Dr Joacim Rocklov told The Telegraph newspaper that after being an outlier earlier in the year, Sweden was shifting to a strategy closer to those adopted by most other governments.</p><p>It will give local authorities the power to strongly recommend people to avoid busy public places like shopping centers, museums, gyms, concerts, and sports matches. Swedes may also be asked to avoid public transport and contact with the elderly and vulnerable.</p><p>\"What's happened in the last couple of weeks is a movement towards a similar model to what has been used in Norway and many other countries,\" he said. \"It's very obvious that it's a new strategy, but still, the newspapers report on 'the Swedish strategy' as if it were fixed in March.\"</p><p>Johan Nojd, who heads Uppsala's infectious diseases department, suggested that he would be prepared to introduce harsher restrictions for the city like new rules for hospitality if the number of cases in the city continued to grow.</p><p>\"Perhaps tomorrow we will have several talking about concerts or restaurants and then perhaps one could say, 'in Uppsala now for two or three weeks it is the Public Health Agency's advice not to sit in restaurants late at night',\" he told the newspaper.</p><p>However, unlike in other countries, there will be no fines or legal consequences for people who decide not to follow any new advice. Bitte Brastad, the chief legal officer at Sweden's public health agency, said the rules were \"something in between regulations and recommendations.\"</p><p>Tegnell this week said that the level of immunity in Sweden's cities was not as high as the health officials had recently believed.</p><p>\"I think the obvious conclusion is that the level of immunity in those cities is not at all as high as we have, as maybe some people have believed,\" he said.</p><p>\"I think what we are seeing is very much a consequence of the very heterogeneous spread that this disease has, which means that even if you feel like there have been a lot of cases in some big cities, there are still huge pockets of people who have not been affected yet.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Bz9wwFFQWMw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 18 Oct 2020 14:54:18 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4ca49e9fe40019009f70?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"4d986ed9049cb2ef1a496ea4e0e5f627","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn69@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-16-921_9ff88d4a07a70fb7.webp","destWidth":1332,"destHeight":999,"sourceBytes":68840,"destBytes":68840,"author":"apayne@businessinsider.com (Adam Payne)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8c4d40c21cfb0019468a6c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-28-474_eef26ef931b45956.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bz9wwFFQWMw:KAjuYUnYNgM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn83@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-33-871_d6ac0c4f54eaa45d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bz9wwFFQWMw:KAjuYUnYNgM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_3/2020/10/18/17-02-28-499_c05cb11107fffef5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bz9wwFFQWMw:KAjuYUnYNgM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn15@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-34-345_9adc0c9ed997a8d1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Bz9wwFFQWMw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn35@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-19-126_a4ab1bec4c7597b9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520925},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"This fully electric delivery truck was built to be much safer to use in cities than the average large vehicle — see the Volta Zero","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/electric-cargo-delivery-volta-zero-truck-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a329a7ed0ee001e25e73f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1517\" width=\"2023\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Volta Trucks has unveiled the Volta Zero, a zero emissions electric cargo delivery vehicle built specifically for use in cities.</li>\n<li>The exterior body panels are made of sustainable and strong flax and biodegradable resin.</li>\n<li>Volta Trucks will begin manufacturing the Volta Zero in 2022 with the goal of producing 5,000 trucks annually by 2025.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://voltatrucks.com/\">Volta Trucks</a> has unveiled the Volta Zero, a zero-emissions electric cargo delivery vehicle built for use in the city.</p><p>According to Volta Trucks' founder Carl-Magnus Norden in a statement, the current widely used large commercial delivery trucks are dangerous: in London, 23% and 58% of pedestrian and cyclist deaths, respectively, are related to \"large good vehicles\" despite its low usage compared to other vehicles, such as daily drivers and public transport.</p><p>Now, the company is hoping to make a change in the commercial cargo delivery segment by making the vehicles safer, which will be done in part by implementing a different layout in the cab and new systems that will increase the drivers' awareness of their surroundings.</p><p>However, safety isn't Volta Trucks' only goal with the Volta Zero. The company is also taking a green approach to its new release by electrifying the fleets and using sustainable building materials, specifically flax and rapeseed oil-sourced resin, on the exterior body panels.</p><p>According to the Sweden-based company, this use of flax and resin on the body will be an industry first when the Volta Zero hits the production line in 2022.</p><p>\"To me, it's so obvious that this is the right thing to do,\" Volta Trucks founder Carl-Magnus Norden <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/volta-trucks-ceo-interview-taking-page-from-apple-tesla-playbook-2020-2\">told Business Insider in an interview in February</a>. \"The industry is acting very slowly. Everybody is talking about 2030, 2040, but nobody feels the urge to do anything today.\"</p><p>The new vehicle will also be a world's first in its own right. According to Volta Trucks, the Volta Zero will be the first fully electric 17.64-ton commercial vehicle built with the intention of delivering cargo and freight within an urban environment.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe company has a goal of improving air quality in urban areas and preventing around 198,416 tons of carbon dioxide from entering the atmosphere by 2025 by using these sustainability made, zero emissions vehicles, according to Volta Truck's CEO Rob Fowler in a statement.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c5057b7da001ee11d8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Volta Zero has 90% less moving components than a traditional vehicle and costs the same as a diesel-powered four-wheeler with the same work purpose, according to its maker.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c6c323fc4001e0d674a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe 17.65-ton vehicle measures at about 31.04 feet long, 11.38 feet tall, and 8.37 feet wide. These dimensions allow the Volta Zero to carry up to about 18,959.8 pounds in the 1,331.33-cubic foot cargo area, all while traveling up to 56 miles-per-hour.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c79323fc4001e0d674c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe vehicle has a range between 95 to 125 miles. According to Volta Trucks, the range and load capacity allow one Volta Zero to do the same work as up to four 3.86-ton vehicles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c1b323fc4001e0d6748?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe vehicle's \"glasshouse-style\" cab provides 220-degrees of visibility, reducing the potential for accidents when used in conjunction with the blind spot warning program,  and rearview and 360-degree birds-eye view cameras.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e8057b7da001ee11da3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnlike traditional cargo delivery trucks, the driver's seat in the Volta Zero sits at around the same height as other drivers and pedestrians. This seat, which can swivel, is also placed centrally, allowing the driver to easily exit or enter on either side of the vehicle.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612c9957b7da001ee11d8c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1817\" width=\"2424\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Volta Zero will also come with an Advanced Driver Assistance System that can electronically aid in tasks like parking and steering.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a326d7ed0ee001e25e73e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to its maker, the interior cab area looks bright and spacious with its touch screen displays and natural colors and materials that give it a \"comfortable yet elegant\" appearance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e76323fc4001e0d6767?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe fleet of Volta Zeros is also set to be the first fully electric commercial vehicle to use an e-Axle, which houses the electric motor, axle, and transmission.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a326b7ed0ee001e25e73d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to Volta Trucks, this lightweight and space-saving e-Axle gives its vehicles a longer range while allowing the lithium-ion phosphate battery to be placed in the chassis rails.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e16323fc4001e0d6763?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis battery supplies between 160 to 200-kilowatt hours of power. According to Volta, it's also stable, which means if the battery is hit during an accident, it won't set itself or the vehicle on fire.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e43323fc4001e0d6766?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTo further the eco-friendly components of the Volta Zero, the exterior body panels are made of flax and rapeseed oil-derived resin that was created by the European Space Agency and Bcomp, a natural fiber maker.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e3e57b7da001ee11da1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1406\" width=\"1875\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe flax fibers — which are combined with the resin for use on the panels — are lightweight and almost carbon neutral while still being as rigid and heavy as carbon fiber.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e3057b7da001ee11da0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe cab's metal space structure, combined with the body panels, has the same durability as \"conventional steel material,\" according to Volta. The panels can also bend, reducing the chance of sharp sides or scrapes in case of an accident.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f612e6a57b7da001ee11da2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe panels can be burned for waste-heat recovery when they are no longer needed, preventing them from occupying space in landfills.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a32687ed0ee001e25e73a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to Volta Trucks, 12 pilot Volta Zero vehicles will be tested in 2021 with Europe-based cargo delivery and logistics companies. Next year will also oversee the creation of 130 jobs within the organization.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a3267e6ff30001d4e7f95?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBy 2022, Volta Trucks will begin manufacturing with the goal of producing 500 Volta Zeros by the end of the year, and 5,000 by 2025.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a325ee6ff30001d4e7f93?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Volta Trucks&#39; electric Volta Zero\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volta Trucks&#39; new Volta Zero.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.voltatrucks.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Volta Trucks</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Rupert Murdoch, whose media empire includes Fox News and the New York Post, is predicting a landslide Biden victory over Trump","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rupert-murdoch-predicts-landslide-biden-victory-over-trump-report-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c00ef9e9fe40019009f59?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Murdoch Trump\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US President Donald Trump (L) is embraced by Rupert Murdoch, Executive Chairman of News Corp, during a dinner to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the Battle of the Coral Sea during WWII onboard the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum May 4, 2017 in New York\n<p class=\"copyright\">BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Media mogul Rupert Murdoch has told people close to him that he believes Democratic candidate Joe Biden will defeat President Trump in the presidential election, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/16/us/trump-biden-town-halls#rupert-murdoch-the-media-titan-is-said-to-be-privately-predicting-a-biden-victory\">reported The New York Times.&#160;</a></li>\n<li>People close to Murdoch told <a href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/fox-news-owner-rupert-murdoch-predicts-a-landslide-win-for-biden?ref=home\">The Daily Beast</a> last week that Fox News owner Murdoch believes the president has botched the response to the coronavirus crisis.&#160;</li>\n<li>Murdoch publications continue to consistently back Trump, with tabloid The New York Post last week publishing a controversial story that sought to damage Biden's candidacy.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Media mogul Rupert Murdoch, owner of the Fox News network and the New York Post, has told people that he thinks Democratic nominee Joe Biden will defeat President Donald Trump in the presidential election, according to reports.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/16/us/trump-biden-town-halls#rupert-murdoch-the-media-titan-is-said-to-be-privately-predicting-a-biden-victory\">The New York Times</a> on Saturday reported that a source familiar with the matter had told them Murdoch believes a Biden victory is most likely, and has even said that the Democrat could triumph over Trump in a landslide.&#160;</p><p>It confirms a report by <a href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/fox-news-owner-rupert-murdoch-predicts-a-landslide-win-for-biden?ref=home\">The Daily Beast last week,</a> with several sources telling that publication that Murdoch has been projecting an emphatic victory for Biden. According to the report, Murdoch believes Trump has refused to listen to the best advice on dealing with the coronavirus crisis.&#160;</p><p>Business Insider has attempted to reach Murdoch for comment on the report. Murdoch declined to comment on the Times' report.</p><p>And in an email to the Beast last week wrote \"no comment except I've never called Trump an idiot,\" referring to a 2018 report claiming that he had called Trump an \"idiot\" after a phone call with the president about migration.&#160;</p><p>Though Murdoch may believe that it's game over for Trump, Fox News hosts continue to be the president's staunchest media allies. Murdoch's tabloid, The New York Post, is embroiled in controversy over a disputed article last week which, reported that unverified emails found on an abandoned laptop contain evidence of dubious business dealing by Biden's son, Hunter, in Ukraine.&#160;</p><p>Social media companies have moved to limit the article's spread,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-laptop-real-fake-russian-intelligence-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">with US intelligence reportedly&#160;</a>investigating whether the emails are part of a Russian disinformation campaign.&#160;</p><p>In the initial months of his presidential candidacy, Trump faced tough questions from Fox News hosts and was described as an <a href=\"https://twitter.com/rupertmurdoch/status/622558129742573568?s=20\">embarrassment by Murdoch in a tweet.</a></p><p>But as his campaign gathered strength, the network abruptly changed its stance and became his ardent backer, with network hosts such as Sean Hannity serving as informal advisers and sounding boards for the president.</p><p>Trump has repeatedly praised the Murdoch family. In January&#160; he <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/trump-praises-murdoch-family-compliments-disney-deal-1269939\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">described Murdoch as \"the greatest\"</a> over his deal-making acumen,&#160;</p><p>But according to the Beast, Rupert Murdoch is beginning to tire of the president. Trump has phoned the media tycoon to complain about what he sees as negative coverage about his administration on Fox News.&#160;</p><p>A rift has opened in the Murdoch family over the editorial direction of the publications.&#160;<a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?q=james+murdoch+business+insider&rlz=1C5CHFA_enGB838GB838&oq=james+murdoch+business+insider+&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l2j69i60l2.5001j0j15&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8=chrome&#38;ie=UTF-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Murdoch's son James Murdoch l</a>ast week told the Times that he had decided to quit his board position for News Corp, the print media wing of his father's business empire, out of concern that some publications are \"legitimizing disinformation.\"&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"A married couple collected more than $1.6 million in debt collection scams across Arizona, according to lawsuit by state's attorney general","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/debt-collection-scam-arizona-attorney-general-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8c5788c21cfb0019468a74?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich\" height=\"976\" width=\"1952\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich speaks at a Tuesday, Jan. 7, 2020, news conference in Phoenix where he announced consumer fraud lawsuits against e-cigarette makers Juul Labs and Eonsmoke.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/VapingArizonaLawsuit/c506a2d4eb0b401e9822ac214785d8d5/photo?Query=organizations.code:b5e3f8a0cbce447693a13d0383a1f688&#38;mediaType=photo,video,graphic,audio&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=86&#38;currentItemNo=0\" target=\"_blank\">Bob Christie/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Arizona <a href=\"https://www.azag.gov/press-release/ag-brnovich-files-consumer-fraud-lawsuit-against-debt-collectors\">Attorney General Mark Brnovich</a> filed a consumer fraud lawsuit against two people that accuses them of defrauding people out of $1.6 million in debt collection scams.</li>\n<li>The scammers are accused of using fake phone numbers to pose as lawyers and law enforcement and threatening people with arrests, something authorized debt collectors are not allowed to do.</li>\n<li>In September, the FTC <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/regulators-crack-down-on-aggressive-dubious-debt-collectors-2020-9\">announced a nationwide crackdown</a> on debt collection scams.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A married couple in Phoenix, Arizona, is being sued by the state's attorney general in a consumer fraud case where they are accused of defrauding potentially thousands of people out of more than $1.6 million.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.azag.gov/press-release/ag-brnovich-files-consumer-fraud-lawsuit-against-debt-collectors\">Attorney General Mark Brnovich said </a>&#160;Mark Anthony Smith and Deborah Ann Butler of impersonating authorities and using fake phone numbers that appeared to come from courthouses, jails, and sheriff's offices for debts they weren't authorized to collect on.</p><p>Smith and Butler threatened to freeze bank accounts, suspend driver's licenses, garnish wages, take away tax returns for possibly thousands of unpaid debts, <a href=\"https://www.azag.gov/sites/default/files/docs/press-releases/2020/complaints/Complaint_against_Mark_Smith_and_Deborah_Butler_2_.pdf\">according to a criminal complaint</a>. They have also been accused of masking their real phone numbers with those of courthouses and sheriff's offices more than 65,800 times to convince people that the calls were legitimate.</p><p>Smith and Butler operated under the company names CMS Financial Group, John Lee Group &#38; Associates, and TD Financial Solutions Group AZ.</p><p>The lawsuit comes as a result of an investigation by the attorney general, the Federal Trade Commission, and more than 50 other federal and state law enforcement agencies. Victims of the scams had filed complaints with the FTC, Better Business Bureau, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.</p><p>The lawsuit calls for the defendants to pay restitution of $1.6 million to victims and $31.7 million in fines. Smith and Butler would also face a lifetime ban from working in debt collection.</p><p>There have been <a href=\"https://public.tableau.com/profile/federal.trade.commission#!/vizhome/DebtCollection/Infographic\">more than 86,000 complaints filed in 2020</a> related to debt collection, according to the FTC. About 45% of those complaints relate to abusive and threatening debt collection practices and calls about debts not owed.</p><p>In September, the FTC <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/regulators-crack-down-on-aggressive-dubious-debt-collectors-2020-9\">announced Operation Corrupt Collector</a>, a nationwide crackdown on debt collection scams. Currently, the effort involves more than 50 actions from the FTC and state cases filed by law enforcement in 16 states including Arizona, California, Massachusetts, North Carolina, and New York.</p><p>There are several red flags to identify debt collection scams. Authorized debt collectors are not allowed to threaten jail time or pose as a government official, <a href=\"https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/articles/0258-fake-and-abusive-debt-collectors\">according to the FTC</a>. They're also not allowed to harass people with repeated phone calls. Debt collectors must verify the debt by providing information like the name of the original creditor and the total amount owed.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/debt-collection-scam-arizona-attorney-general-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Balogh)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8c5788c21cfb0019468a74?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn60@2020_4/2020/10/18/17-02-33-029_332ca541888fc7b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn36@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-32-732_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ddn12CRxaiw:jj1hfFVVBsY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn59@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-21-772_6aad970c2d76270b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ddn12CRxaiw:jj1hfFVVBsY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn52@2020_5/2020/10/18/17-02-35-534_b2e1d95fd2e803a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-187_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ddn12CRxaiw:jj1hfFVVBsY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn39@2020_6/2020/10/18/17-02-26-416_11798eff76934ea2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ddn12CRxaiw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn100@2020_2/2020/10/18/17-02-25-966_5be9429e5d4d7aed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603040520883},{"createdTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-19 01:02:00","title":"Flippy, the $30,000 automated robot fast-food cook, is now for sale with 'demand through the roof' — see how it grills burgers and fries onion rings","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/miso-robotics-flippy-robot-on-sale-for-300000-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c377d260780019341d96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Team Member Next to Flippy ROAR at the Fryer_3\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Miso Robotics' kitchen robot, Flippy, just became available to purchase for $30,000.</li>\n<li>Flippy can cook 19 items, including burgers and hash browns.</li>\n<li>Flippy works as a kitchen assistant, moving along a rail.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Robots can flip burgers and fry sides, and Miso Robotics is selling its burger-flipping robot as the perfect fry cook for the COVID-19 era.</p><p>Robot assistant Flippy just became commercially available for <a href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2020/10/06/you-can-now-order-miso-robotics-latest-kitchen-robot-for-30000/\">$30,000</a>, or on a payment plan, with plans to eventually lower the price. Flippy is attached to a rail under the kitchen hood to move back and forth while manning the grill and fryer.</p><p>\"After we shared a sneak peek of the prototype in January, we've seen demand through the roof from operators, especially in light of COVID-19\" Miso Robotics CEO Mike Bell said in a press release. The coronavirus pandemic has hit restaurants hard, but fast-food chains have recovered faster with the drive-thru <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fast-food-chains-turn-to-drive-thru-during-pandemic-2020-8\">and takeout</a> business not relying on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/casual-dining-chains-in-a-state-of-limbo-in-pandemic-2020-8\">indoor dining</a>, compared to fast-casual chains.</p><p>During the pandemic, fast food employees have become <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-exposes-problems-that-festered-in-fast-food-2020-4\">essential workers,</a> and labor issues like lack of paid sick time and low wages were thrown into the spotlight. Robots like Flippy in the kitchen could keep fast food locations competitive despite \"smaller margins, less foot traffic and new health and safety concerns,\" Miso says.</p><p>Here's how Flippy works.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tMiso first introduced Flippy at the grill in 2018, as the first burger flipping robot in the world. It could grill 150 burgers each hour.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89b8679e9fe40019009c1d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippys_Kitchen\" height=\"1444\" width=\"1925\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe first version of Flippy could detect when raw patties were placed on the grill and monitor them to cook to order. It also cleaned spatulas and scraped the grill in between burgers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89b5af9e9fe40019009c08?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippy_Scraping\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLater that year, Flippy also gained the ability to work as a frying assistant, piloted at Dodger Stadium.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c212d260780019341d8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippy at Fryer_Model 2.0\" height=\"1152\" width=\"1536\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlippy was able to place baskets in the fryer, shake baskets in oil, and monitor for appropriate cooking time to make chicken tenders and tots.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ac639e9fe40019009bba?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippy ROAR[1]\" height=\"304\" width=\"540\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn January 2020, Miso announced an updated Flippy operating while attached to a rail.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c377d260780019341d96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Team Member Next to Flippy ROAR at the Fryer_3\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe design was created to assist busy cooks in a quick-service kitchen, installed under a kitchen hood to move along equipment while staying out of the staff's way.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c3c69e9fe40019009c73?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FlippyROAR_IMAGE\" height=\"885\" width=\"1180\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBy 2020, Flippy had contracts with Dodger Stadium, Chase Field, and multiple CaliBurger locations.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0c7ed63f737013dc7bb75a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippy White Castle robot\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of White Castle</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn 2019, Flippy served more than 15,000 burgers and over 31,000 lbs of chicken tenders and tots.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c4549e9fe40019009c76?format=jpeg\" alt=\"White Castle Menu Items_Fried by Flippy_2.JPG\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" Flippy.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ac4b9e9fe40019009bb9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"White Castle Menu Items_Fried by Flippy\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the midst of a pandemic, implementing Flippy is also a way to reduce human contact with food before it is served, and hopefully, also reduce virus transmission.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c49c9e9fe40019009c78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flippy White Castle robot\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of White Castle</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor further food safety, Miso teamed up with Pathspot Technologies, which can scan employees' hands after washing to ensure that they are safe to handle food.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c58f9e9fe40019009c7e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"01 Front view of Flippy station 2\" height=\"1048\" width=\"1398\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAdvances in Flippy and its AI technology have made it work better with human staff while taking over some of the most dangerous jobs, like frying.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c62cd260780019341da9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"02 Front view of Flippy station with kitchen staff.JPG\" height=\"1242\" width=\"1657\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tChefUI, Miso's proprietary software, can identify food types and temperatures, and learn new foods.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA monitor on the robot tells the staff what orders are up next, and staff can also adjust cooking times here for custom orders.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c6219e9fe40019009c81?format=jpeg\" alt=\"05 Flippy monitor close up.JPG\" height=\"1242\" width=\"1657\" including burgers, chicken wings, onion rings, and more.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c5e69e9fe40019009c80?format=jpeg\" alt=\"01 Front view of Flippy station.JPG\" height=\"1242\" width=\"1657\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUpdates have also allowed Flippy to properly cook the Impossible Burger, which has a different texture and thickness than a traditional burger, so it requires a different grilling technique.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c732d260780019341db1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"04 Close up of Flippy arm.JPG\" height=\"1242\" width=\"1657\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flippy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miso Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlippy is able to be completely washed down, and tools are automatically switched and cleaned too.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img Robotics</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
